He travels by bus and at times by car; it takes 29  minutes to arrive to his work. He works from 8 AM until 4 PM. Pedro needs a loan to adjust the motor and repair the steering of the vehicle he has. The car is indispensable for his transportation to work and return home as with his schedule he almost always arrive during the dark to his home. Pedro dreams of having a larger house where they can live more comfortably and that his family lives in dignified living conditions.

loans.use: to adjust the motor and repair the steering of the vehicle he has.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, wood, and iron to build a shed.

loans.name: Earn

texts.en:
Earn is a new client of UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd. He is a married man aged 33 years with two children, and is a resident of Tuula-kawempe on the outskirts of Kampala. Earn is a hard-working businessman who owns a taxi that operates from a taxi park in the city. He is faced with the challenges of competition and traffic jams in town.

In a bid to improve his standard of living and save the costs of rent in the city, he has applied for a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan shillings which he wants to use for the construction of a residential house for his family. He will use income from the taxi to repay the loan.  

Earn is very grateful for the support offered to him by UGAFODE Microfinance.

loans.use: To buy construction materials such as bricks, cement, timber, etc.

loans.name: Martha Carolina

texts.es:
Fue hace 4 años que Martha Carolina de 34 años de edad decidió independizarse y montar su propio negocio.  Esta decisión ha beneficiado de igual manera a los habitantes de su comunidad ya que ofrece productos que son de utilidad diaria y debido a la carencia de pulperías en los alrededores son difíciles de conseguir. Para aprovechar la demanda de sus productos solicita préstamos para comprar  aceite, arroz, azúcar y dar a su clientela más variedad de precios y productos.
Martha posee el deseo de diversificar su negocio, su meta es abrir un nuevo  negocio de fritanga, nacatamales y elotes cocidos.  Afirma que su punto de ubicación es clave para este negocio y espera tener mucho éxito. Sus expectativas son lograr cada meta propuesta y con los ingresos  realizar mejoras necesarias  a su vivienda.
texts.en:
It was four years ago when Martha Carolina, age 34, decided to become independent and establish her own business.  This decision has benefited, in the same way, the inhabitants of her community.  She sells products that are used daily, and due to the lack of grocery stores in the surrounding areas they are difficult to get.  In order to take advantage of the demand for her products, she is requesting a loan to buy cooking oil, rice, and sugar.  This way she will give her customers a greater variety of prices and products.

Martha wishes to diversify her business.  Her goal is to open a new business selling grilled foods, ‘nacatamales’ [steamed corn cakes], and cooked corn on the cob.  She states that her location is the key to this business, and she hopes to have a lot of success.  Her expectation is to achieve each proposed goal, and to use the earnings to make needed improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Justino

texts.es:
El señor Justino es de la ciudad de San Ignacio de profesión comerciante, está casado y tiene hijos, es de familia humilde y trabajadora, cuenta con un local comercial de productos agrícolas y balanceados para animales de granja, cuenta con local propio más vehículo que con esfuerzo pudo conseguir.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar semillas y balanceados para poder seguir con su trabajo, luchando por su familia, para darles un buen futuro.
texts.en:
Justino is from San Ignacio city and is a vendor. He is married and has children. He is from a humble and hard-working family. He has a business selling agricultural products and balanced feed for farm animals. He has his own locale and vehicle that through his efforts he was able to obtain.

He seeks a loan to be able to buy seed and balanced animal feed in order to be continue with his work, fighting for his family and giving them a good future.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and seeds.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene lives in Kampala, Uganda, where she is a married mother of two children, both attending school. She rents a house with access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

Irene has been selling clothes six days a week from her boutique for the last three years. Her challenges include seasonality.

Irene joined MCDT because its goal is to help women get out of poverty. She has requested a loan of 400,000  Ugandan Shillings from MCDT- SACCO to enable her stock more skirts, blouses, t-shirts and dresses.  Her dream is to open up another boutique in the same area.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es: Blanca es una mujer de 59 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia desde hace 55 años. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida desde hace 2 años con la crianza de pollos y una venta de comida que instalo en un lugar de mucha afluencia de personas. Blanca desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda que se encuentra deteriorado, y así evitar las filtraciones de lluvia que se presentan en su vivienda.
texts.en: Blanca is a 59 year old woman who has lived in her own home for 55 years. She is a hard-working woman who for the past 2 years has earned a living raising chickens and selling food in a locale that she opened in an affluent area. Blanca wishes to change the roof of her home and therefore she asked FUSAI for a loan to invest in galvanized laminate, wood, and nails to change the roof of her home as it is deteriorating. Repairs will take care of the leaks that she currently has in her home.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized laminate, wood, and nails to change the roof of her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy laminate, wood, and iron to build a hallway in her home.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
For the past 10 years, Sophia has been in the poultry business from which she earns a monthly income of 9,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). She is married to Michael and blessed with seven school-going children.

Sophia has applied for her third loan of 10,559 KES from VisionFund Kenya. She intends to use the loan amount to buy a solar lamp for use on her farm.

Sophia will use the anticipated profits to pay her children's school fees. She hopes to grow her business and to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 54 years old and is married with one child attending school. She has been earning a living by raising pigs in the Philippines for 10 years. She earns additional income from her general store.

Teresa is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream which is to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jose Alonso

texts.es:
José, de 69 años de edad, estudió hasta primer grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar, tienen 3 hijos, solamente una hija vive con ellos. 

Es agricultor desde hace 18 años, oficio que aprendió de su padre, actualmente ha sembrado 7,500 metros cuadrados de maíz y 500 metros cuadrados de pipián a unos 40 minutos de su hogar, viaja en su vehículo para ayudarle a uno de sus hijos en las labores agrícolas. 

El préstamo es para pagar el alquiler de tierra, la mano de obra y además, necesita comprar el abono y fertilizantes para su cultivo, con esta cosecha mejorara su vida porque obtendrá mayores ingresos para su familia.

José, espera que el cultivo de buenas ganancias, para invertir en la vivienda, pagar el préstamo y para trabajar en las siguientes siembras.
texts.en: José is 69 years old, completed 1st grade, is married, and his wife works in the home. They have 3 children and only one daughter lives with them. He has been farming for 18 years, a skill he learned from his father. Today he has planted 7500 square meters of corn and 500 square meters of chili on land 40 minutes from his home. He travels by vehicle to help one of his children with the farm chores. The loan is to pay the rent for the land, labor costs, and to buy manure and fertilizers for his crops. With this the harvest will improve resulting in greater income for his family. Jose hopes that the crops bring good profits in order to inveset in his home, pay the loan, and be able to work in the subsequent plantings.

loans.use: to pay the rent for the land, labor costs, and to buy manure and fertilizers for his crops.

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various merchandise like biscuits, chips, noodles, pouch vinegar, powdered milk, sugar, noodles, and soft drinks. She is 49 years old and has one, grown dependent. She lives in Ormoc, Leyte. Aside from running a store, she raises and sells hogs.

Clemencia is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP. She will use it to buy additional stock for the store and pig feed. She can fill again her store with various stock, and hopefully, she could raise more healthy pigs, in a few months.

She hopes that she could manage both of her businesses very well. This could be the way to become sustainable, in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for the store and pig feed.

loans.name: Emile Guadalupe

texts.es: Emile de 34 años de edad es una mujer que habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos y un sobrino. Ella es una mujer que pone todo su empeño en darle lo mejor a los suyos prestando sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar desde hace mucho tiempo. Emile desea construir una cocina y un baño en su vivienda, pero no cuenta con la liquidez económica necesaria, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir una cocina y el baño de su vivienda.
texts.en: Emile is 34 years old and lives in her own home with her 2 children and a nephew. She is a woman who puts all her effort into providing the best to her loved ones. She has worked as a domestic employee for a long time. Emile wishes to build a kitchen and bathroom in her home, but doesn't have enough liquid capital. Therefore she seeks a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron to build a kitchen and bathroom in her home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron to build a kitchen and bathroom in her home.

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Mujeres En Acción, ya que ellas decidieron trabajar y ponerse en acción para poder crecer y salir adelante,  están en su ciclo número 27º del programa de comité, es un grupo muy antiguo que trabaja unido. Están además en el programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Nilda es miembro, pero también es la presidenta del grupo, se destaca por ser una persona muy entusiasta y trabajadora, que se esfuerza por poder salir adelante y también para motivar a sus compañeras de grupo. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas, y por medio de ese trabajo tiene el ingreso para cubrir su día a día.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas, como ser: remeras, short, camisillas, pantalón, pollera, toallas, etc., todas agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben de poder crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
The group is called Mujeres En Acción, since they decided to work and put themselves to action in order to be able to grow and get ahead. They are in their 27th loan cycle in the committee program; it is a very old group that works closely. In addition, they are in the poverty elimination program.

Nilda is a member, but she is also the president of the group. She stands out as a very enthusiastic and hard-working person, since she works hard to be able to get ahead and also to motivate her group-mates.  She works selling various clothing articles, and through this work she has an income to cover the day-to-day costs.

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase various clothing articles such as t-shirts, shorts, shirts, pants, polleras (traditional Adean skirts), towels, etc. They are all grateful for the opportunity they get to be able to grow and get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase t-shirts, shorts, shirts, pants, polleras (traditional Andean skirts), and towels.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, and labor costs to replaster the walls of her house.

loans.name: Los Invencibles Group

texts.es: William es un señor emprendedor de 47 años de edad, casado y tiene tres hijos menores de edad. Ser comerciante lo heredó de su familia, siempre le ha gustado trabajar de manera independiente y generar sus propios ingresos, por ello plantó una pequeña tienda y bazar en su domicilio; paralelo a ello también se dedica a la agricultura. Brindar comodidad a su familia no ha sido fácil en estos años de negociante. Sin embargo su objetivo principal es darle estudios superiores a sus tres hijos. La tarea no será difícil por el ímpetu de William para ello se esfuerza mucho en su negocio y el capital lo invertirá en abarrotes y panetones este último por la festividad navideña próxima. Se siente privilegiado por haber recibido el apoyo de los inversionistas KIVA y agradece de corazón. William viste polo blanco del lado izquierdo.
texts.en: William is an enterprising man, 47 years old, married and he has three minor children. He inherited being a salesperson from his family. He has always liked to work independently and generate his own income. For this reason, he established a small shop and bazaar (general store) in his house. Along with that, he also works in agriculture. To offer comfort to his family has not been easy in these years as a businessman. However, his principal goal is to provide higher education to his three children. The work will not be difficult due to the William's energy with which he puts effort into his business and the loan will be invested in groceries and sweet breads, the latter for the upcoming Christmas holiday. He feels privileged to have received to the support of the Kiva investors and he has heartfelt gratitude. William wears a while t-shirt on the left side.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and sweet breads.

loans.name: Carlos Ernesto

texts.es: Carlos es un hombre de 54 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y su madre de 75 años de edad, por lo que se siente feliz de poder apoyarla en su vejez. Él es un hombre que se gana la vida con su negocio de venta de comida y golosinas el cual se encuentra en un lugar turístico por lo que cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes. Carlos desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que este actualmente se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: Carlos is a 54-year-old man who lives in his own house with his life partner and 75-year-old mother, so he is happy to be able to support her in her old age. He is a man who earns his living with a business selling food and sweets which is found in a touristic location, which means he has a good number of customers. Carlos wants to replace the roof on his house since it currently is deteriorated, so he asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood, and nails to replace the roof on his house.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood and nails to replace the roof on his house.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 37 years old, married and, together with her spouse, has been blessed with two children. She has a profitable hotel business in Nairobi town which she has been running for two years.  

Francisca will use this loan to buy more stocks of flour, rice, vegetables (including carrots) and cooking oil for use in her business. She will be able to serve more customers and earn more income which she will use to open another business. 

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya: in future, she hopes to expand her business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of flour, rice, vegetables (including carrots) and cooking oil for use in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in laminated metal sheeting, wood, nails, and wire, and to pay for labor for the construction of a shed at his house

loans.name: Sula

texts.en:
Sula is a new client of UGAFODE Microfinance Limited. He is a permanent resident of Kisugu-Makindye, Kampala District. He is a married man, aged 47 years, with seven children.

Sula is a businessman. He owns a retail shop located in Kisugu-Makindye, Kampala. In order to increase his working capital and expand the business, he has applied for a loan. However, he is faced with challenges of limited capital, competition, and lack of security for his business.

He is very grateful for the support UGAFODE has offered to him, because now he is able to fund his business, meet his customers' needs, and increase his profits. Sula is a very hard-working man.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in the shop -- for example, sugar, rice, corn flour, and beverages.

loans.name: Nagina

texts.en:
Nagina is 30 years old and the mother of two children. Her husband runs a pharmacy near a local hospital in Lahore.  He is experienced and has good knowledge about medicines as he has eight years of experience in this field. He spends most of the time at his pharmacy selling drugs and medicines. He is careful and treats his customers with respect.

In order to enhance his pharmacy, he wants to buy more of the medicines that have a higher demand in order to ensure customer retention and to attract new customers. Therefore, Nagina has requested a loan for this purpose from BRAC Pakistan. Nagina and her husband are hopeful that the result of this investment will be fruitful.

loans.use: to buy more medicines to enhance her husband's pharmacy

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fresh vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more chickens, hens, and ducks to sell and, in turn, be able to increase her income and give her family better conditions.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 39 years old and married. She has three children, one of whom is in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF, which she will use to purchase more groceries to sell.

Clarita has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF, before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years, and she earns additional income from pig fattening. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Las 18 integrantes de este grupo, cuentan con actividades variadas, cada una de ellas ponen su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y ayudar a sus familias por medio de su trabajo.
La señora Florentina es la presidenta de este grupo, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, y siempre lucha por ser el ejemplo para sus compañeras, mientras ella trabaja en la venta de prendas varias que hace de forma ambulante, ella es muy sacrificada y luchadora.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar remeras, camisas, jeans, blusas y demás, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que tiene, que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The 18 members of this group have a variety of jobs; each one of them puts forth her best effort to be able to grow and help their families through their work.

Florentina is the president of this group, she is a very hard-working woman and always struggles to be an example for her group-mates, while she works selling a variety of clothing which she does as a street vendor. She is very self-sacrificing and determined.

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase t-shirts, shirts, jeans, blouses, and others, and in this way to be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing. 

She is grateful for this opportunity that she has, which will be of much help to her.

loans.use: to purchase t-shirts, shirts, jeans, blouses and others.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Guapa  está en su ciclo número 3º  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. En este grupo todas desean superarse y poder salir adelante.
La Sra. Olga es la Presidenta del grupo, ella es empleada en una institución y en sus ratos libres con sus compañeras de grupo realizan ferias de comidas, y manualidades para la venta, por lo tanto el préstamo que ella pide es para la compra de ingredientes para las comidas y también para insumos de sus manualidades. Ella agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder ir mejorando cada día.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa group is in its 3rd loan cycle in the women's committee program, where they all work and help each other to get ahead. In this group, they all want to improve themselves and be able to get ahead.

Olga is the president of the group. She is employed in an institution and in her free time, with her group-mates, they hold fairs with food and handicrafts for sale, so the loan that she asks for is to purchase the ingredients for the food and also supplies for her handicrafts. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is getting to be able to continue improving each day.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for meals and supplies for her handicrafts.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
María Luisa es una comerciante que desde hace años ha luchado por sacar su negocio adelante a pesar de las bajas ventas y los altos precios de los productos en el mercado. En su casa de hogar tiene establecido una pequeña pulpería en las que  ofrece  producto de limpieza, granos básicos, confites etc. a toda su comunidad. Con los ingresos que deja este pequeño negocio es muy difícil reinvertirlos, ya que posee 3 hijos que van a la escuela  y la mayor parte de las ganancias  de la pulpería son para materiales escolares o necesidades del hogar. Solicita préstamo para comprar productos tales como aceite, azúcar, granos básicos, bebidas embolsadas etc. y surtir su venta.
Su apoyo en el negocio es su esposo, quien ronda las calles de la ciudad ofreciendo servicios de taxy. Después de agrandar su pulpería con el préstamo, planea establecer una comidera en algún punto clave de su ciudad, dividir su tiempo en ambos  negocios y multiplicar sus ingresos. Con esto María Luisa lograra realizar arreglos  que precisa  la casa donde ella y toda su  hermosa familia habitan.
texts.en:
María Luisa is a business woman who for years has struggled to get her business ahead despite the low sales and the high prices of the products in the market. In her home, she has established a small grocery store where she offers cleaning products, basic grains, candies, etc. to the whole community. With the income that this small business produces, it is very difficult to reinvest it, since she has 3 children who go to school and the larger part of the grocery store earnings are used for school supplies or household needs. She asks for this loan to purchase products such as oil, sugar, basic grains, packaged drinks, etc. and to vary her sales. 

Her support in this business is her husband, who goes around the city streets offering taxi services. After expanding her grocery store with the loan, she plans to establish a restaurant in some key location in the city, and divide her time in both businesses and multiply her income. With this, María Luisa will manage to do the repairs needed by the house where she and her whole lovely family lives.

loans.use: to purchase products such as oil, sugar, basic grains, packaged drinks, etc.

loans.name: Elda

texts.es:
Elda es soltera, vive con sus padres, ella estudia y trabaja al mismo tiempo. Es empleado de una ferretería, y está cursando el tercer año de la carrera de Licenciatura Contable.
Esta esforzándose para poder crecer y salir y es por eso que esta estudiando para poder destacarse. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar una notebook. Su meta es culminar sus estudios y llegar a ser un profesional y poder servir a su familia.
texts.en:
Elda is single, lives with her parents, and she studies and works at the same time. She is an employee in a hardware store and is in her third year in her accounting degree program.

She is working hard to be able to grow and get ahead and it is for this that she is studying to be able to stand out.  She asks for this loan to be able to purchase a notebook computer. Her goal is to complete her education and become a professional and be able to serve her family.

loans.use: to purchase a notebook computer.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac has a kerosene selling shop in Nairobi town and has been running this business for 11 years. He is 53 years old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with four children.

He will use this loan to pay school fees for his child who is in college. He will use the anticipated profits from his business to educate his children. This is his eighth loan term from VisionFund Kenya and he has paid back his previous loans successfully.

In the future he hopes to have a prosperous business and improve the education standards of his children by paying for their school fees.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his child who is in college.

loans.name: Daniel Ishaya

texts.en: Daniel Ishaya is a maize farmer from Gogarma village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Daniel Ishaya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Daniel Ishaya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Daniel Ishaya, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en: Jean Claude is 28 years old. He is married with two children aged between one and seven years old. One of them goes to school. He sells construction materials and has been in the business for seven years. With the loan, he would like to buy cement, doors and windows to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy cement, doors and windows to sell.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 51 years old and married with nine children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Merlinda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Merlinda has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns additional income from selling ice candy.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Donathille

texts.en: Donathille is 43 years old. She is married with three children aged between 10 and 21 years old, all of whom go to school. She sells food stuffs and has been doing business for 15 years. With the loan, she would like to buy beans, potatoes and vegetables to resell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy beans, potatoes and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Safayanu

texts.en: Safayanu is a maize farmer from Hayin Malam Yako village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Safayanu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Safayanu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Safayanu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is a sari-sari store owner from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is 34 years old, married and has two children ages four and two. Jean has operated her store for more than five years now.
Jean wants to expand her business but lacks the financial resources to do so. Jean is requesting to take a loan to buy more merchandise to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and other beverages, soap, toiletries, rice, biscuits and snack foods. This loan will enable her to improve her inventory, thus attracting more buyers to her store. 
In the future, Jean hopes of making her business sustainable and productive. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: L.l. Henjou English School Group (E)

texts.en:
Ngahneng is a 40-year-old loving and caring mother of three boys and a girl. They live in Quarter Veng at Saikul village, about 30 kilometres from Imphal town. Ngahneng is the featured borrower of the group. She and her son are pictured with their hands raised.

She supports her children’s education by weaving different types of shawls and selling them, with an income of about 5,000 INR per month. Her husband is a cultivator and helps in maintaining the family’s daily supplements. Their income does not meet their total household expenses with the small income from her weaving. They give their best to support the children, but face difficulty to pay educational fees for four children at the beginning of new school sessions. Paying school admission fees for four children at one time is quite a big amount, and most parents with low income face financial instability during this time of the year.

With the Kiva loan, Ngahneng will pay for the school admission fees, textbooks, exercise books, and other annual fees for her son. She has high hopes for the children’s education and believes that they will be successful in the future. Her children are very good in their studies and take a keen interest in their school activities.

She is very happy and feels enlightened. She has no more worries about her son’s school admission fees after availing herself of the loan. Her financial insecurities are finally unburdened.

All the group members are very happy with the loan and send their good wishes to the lenders.

loans.use: to pay for school admission fees, textbooks, exercise books, and other annual fees for the academic year 2015.

loans.name: Haidar Group

texts.en:
Rima is the featured borrower for Haidar Group. She joined with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan, because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Rima is a 30-year-old, married mother of four children. Due to the limited salary of her husband, which is not enough anymore to cover the increasing needs and expenses of the family, she decided to start a clothes selling business to help her husband. Thus, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with different clothes collections, especially for the winter and Christmas season to attract customers. This loan is very important to Rima for it will help her to increase her family's income and improve their living conditions. 

Rima is the second lady standing on the left of the photo. With respect to the other members of the group, Hanaa is the first lady standing on the left, Fatima is the second lady sitting on the right, and Bahiah is the first lady sitting on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to start a clothes selling business and to buy different clothes collections.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is 38 years old. She is a widow blessed with one child who is 20 years old. Serah also has a grandchild who is one year now. Serah takes care of both her child and grandchild.

Serah sells secondhand clothes, a business she has done for the last five years, and earns a monthly income of Kshs. 45,000
Serah has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kshs,. 20,000 which she will use buy bales of secondhand clothes for resale

With the anticipated profits, Serah will be able to to educate her only child so that she, in turn, can be able to educate hers.

Her hope and dream for the future is to prosper together with her family.

loans.use: to buy bales of secondhand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes at wholesale.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 46 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by farming rice and vegetables in the Philippines. Vilma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Vilma has been farming rice and vegetables for twenty years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: L.l Henjou English School Group (F)

texts.en:
Sital, 28 years old, is a homemaker from Ekou Bazar at Saikul village. She has one daughter and two sons. She and her daughter are pictured with their hands raised among the group members. She is the featured borrower of the group.

Sometimes she helps her husband in receiving their business as a saleswoman in their shop, which has an income of around 8,000 INR per month. Running a shop in the hill area is sometimes fruitless due to fewer customers. Their household income totally relies on the shop’s income, which sometimes leads to hardship for school fees payment on time for her child.

Their unstable income results in them having to choose an education loan as the only option for their child to go for further studies. They want their children to have good, formal education so that they will be able to support themselves in the future. They cannot afford to pay school admission fees for all the children at one time, which leads them to search for alternate options for paying on time.

With the Kiva loan, she will pay school admission fees and other fees for her daughter. She is filled with pleasure to fulfill her children’s dreams to pay their school fees on time. Her children are hardworking and inculcate their time on their studies.

The rest of the group members are also caring mothers who want their children to have good, formal education and to pay their fees on time. They are filled with pleasure and send their gratitude to the lenders.

loans.use: to pay school admission fees and purchase stationery items needed for her daughter.

loans.name: Sisiliya

texts.en: Sisiliya is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Sisiliya joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Samaila, Lami and Ibrahim. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Sisiliya would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan, and Babban Gona’s support, Sisiliya can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Sisiliya spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to make more money for herself and her family.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis vive con sus padres, es una persona con un gran sueño, el cual es poder convertirse en un excelente medico, y poder ayudar a las demás personas.
Actualmente tiene como meta terminar su carrera de medico, desea cumplir el sueño de ser un profesional y asi lograr obtener un buen trabajo para mejorar sus ingresos y ayudar a la calidad de vida a toda su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y cubrir otros gastos que vayan a surgir.
texts.en: Luis lives with his parents and he is a person who has a grand dream to become an excellent doctor and be able to help other people. Today he has the goal of finishing his medical studies. He wants to complete the dream of being a professional and in this way obtaining a good job in order to improve his income and help the quality of life of the whole family. He seeks a loan to pay university tuition and cover other university expenses that are going to up come up.

loans.use: to pay university tuition and cover other university expenses.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, actualmente está cursando el último año de la carrera de ingeniería agronómica, comenta que a la vez que  estudia también esta trabajando.
Su sueño y su meta es terminar su universidad, seguir trabajando y formar una empresa primeramente familiar y después ampliar y seguir creciendo como profesional en su área.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus metas. Agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo de poder crecer.
texts.en: Pedro is from San Ignacio city. Today he is in the last year of his university studies, majoring in agricultural engineering. He says the he is working as well as studying. His dream and goal is to finish the university, continue working, and form a family business and then expand and continue growing as a professional in his field. He seeks a loan to be able to pay university tuition for his studies, and in this way continue toward his goals. He is thankful for this opportunity that he is receiving to be able to grow.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Mauro

texts.es:
El Sr. Mauro está casado, se dedica a la docencia y también tiene una despensa en su casa y por las noches estudia.
La carrera que está siguiendo es la de licenciatura en guaraní,  gracias a su trabajo él puede estudiar. Es una persona muy responsable y dedicada a sus estudios y a su familia, aspira a ser un buen profesional y seguir estudiando y servir a las personas  por medio de sus conocimientos.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir los gastos de su tesis, y de esa forma poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en: Mauro is married. He is a teacher and also has a general store in his home and in the evenings he goes to school. He is studying for a degree in Guarani (an indigenous language). Thanks to his work he can study. He is a very responsible person and dedicated to his studies and his family. He aspires to be a good professional and continue studying and serving people through his knowledge. He seeks this loan to be able to pay his thesis expenses and in this way be able to cover the expenses he has.

loans.use: to pay his thesis expenses.

loans.name: Fatima Maribel

texts.es: Fatima de 31 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de ropa para damas y caballeros por mayor y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Fatima is 31 years old. She is a single mother who lives in her own home with her three children. She has been selling clothing for a few years. With what she obtains from the sales she is able to get ahead. She is seeking a loan to buy clothing for men and women at wholesale and in this way have greater income.

loans.use: to buy clothing for men and women at wholesale.

loans.name: Chynar

texts.en:
Chynar is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Business Administration. Here is her story:

“I am requesting this loan so that I can pay my degree fees. As a result, I can continue studying at AUCA and get a degree. This year, my family is facing a financial difficulty that forced me to count on Kiva loan.

I have a big family: my father, my mother, my three siblings and me. My father is a doctor and proud of his job. It’s unjust to have a small salary, being a public servant. If we lived in Europe or in America, he would earn much more money. My mother took a maternity leave not long ago as she gave a birth to sweet twins.  I am the eldest one and the other siblings study at school. Despite everything, we are happy to have a big and friendly family, where everyone cares for others.

Since the 9th grade I have had a dream to study at AUCA. AUCA is the most prestigious university of Central Asia. It provides accredited degrees from Bard University in New York. Besides, it has majority of partner programs with many universities of the world, where AUCA’s students can study by Exchange Study programs. Finally, AUCA’s main goals are its’ students’ freedom of self-expression, critical thinking and academic honesty. I am a freshman in the Business Administration Department, which prepares experts in Business Administration, Accounting, Management, Human Resources, Marketing and so on. All these professionals are called for in Kyrgyzstan. 

If I graduate from AUCA, I will be able to have a magistrate degree in Europe, find a well-paid job, support my family, finally, and make a contribution in a bettering Kyrgyzstan’s economy.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en: Immaculee is 43 years old. She is married with three children aged between ten and 21 years, all of them go to school.  She sells foodstuffs and has been in business for 15 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more potatoes, beans and bananas to resell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and to reinvest.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes, beans and bananas to resell.

loans.name: Parul

texts.en:
Parul is a humble, simple, and hardworking woman who devotes herself every day to agriculture. She is engaged in production of vegetable and medicinal herb seeds.

She has a son attending school to have a better education. Parul is illiterate, so she is working very hard to give a good education for her son. Her family lives in a thatch-roofed house. Their home is located in the Patghara village of North 24 Parganas district in West Bengal.

Parul wishes to expand her current production. For this reason, she needs to apply for a loan for the production of more seeds. Thus, she can improve her income for the sake of her son’s education and her family.

loans.use: to produce more seeds.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, all of whom attend school. She is not looking after any other member of her family. She has been selling raw food and vegetables in the market at retail for the last 14 years, working seven days a week.

She has requested a loan of UGX 400,000 from MCDT- SACCO, to enable her to stock more green bananas, different yams, cabbages, tomatoes, potatoes both sweet and Irish and vegetables to sell. Her challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her dream is to buy land and start farming. She joined MCDT because of the relatively low interest charged on loans. She rents a house without access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, cabbages, vegetables, sweet potatoes, and yams.

loans.name: Idalina

texts.es:
Idalina es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, está estudiando y a la vez trabaja, ya que es la única forma de poder ser alguien en la vida.
Está estudiando la carrera de licenciatura en administración de farmacias, y por medio de sus estudios quiere abrirse camino y poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Idalina is from Paraguari city. She is studying and working at the same time, as this is the only way to be able to be someone in life. She is studying to be a licensed pharmacist, and through her studies she wants to open up the path to her future and be able to help her family. She seeks this loan to pay university tuition for her studies, and in this way be able to continue with her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Andy

texts.en:
Andy, 38, is a hardworking entrepreneur, from Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Ana Grace, and has two children who are not yet of school age. His wife takes care of their kids, while Andy has handled their fruit and vegetable stand for six years already in a public market.

Andy buys jackfruit and tofu, and vegetables such as onions and garlic from a local farm, which he sells at the town market.  His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He is thankful that he makes a good income from this. He earns a minimum of PHP 1,500 in sales everyday. 

Andy is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to purchase more varieties of fruits and vegetables to sell to improve his sales and income. It will be a big help to cover their daily personal and household needs. He is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given him. He wishes everyone a Blessed Christmas!

Andy aims to grow his business, so he can save and build a house for his family. He wants to send his kids in good schools once they are ready for schooling. He meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables such as onions and garlic, and fruits such as jackfruit and also tofu (soya ).

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del grupo Santa Librada forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, a través del cual, y sumado a las capacitaciones irán mejorando situación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Noelia quien en su primera encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, lo que quiere decir que ha mejorado bastante. Ella tiene una peluquería en la que trabaja todos los días, y ya que tiene muchos clientes le va muy bien,  y sueña con poder seguir creciendo y dar trabajo a otras personas.
La Sra. Noelia solicita de este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para su peluquería, como ser shampoo, enjuagues, cremas, y otros productos varios, de manera a seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The members of the Santa Librada group are part of the program to eliminate poverty, which includes trainings to improve their economic situations.

One of the members if Noelia, who in her first survey demonstrated a level 3 level of poverty, which means that she has improved considerably. She has a beauty salon in which she works every day , and she now has many customers and her business is going very well. She dreams of being able to continue growing and give work to other people.

Noelia seeks a loan to be able to buy supplies for her beauty shop, such as shampoo, rinses, creams, and a variety of other products and in this way continue giving good service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, rinses, creams, and a variety of other products.

loans.name: Liberata

texts.en: Liberata is 42 years old. She is married and has three children between the ages of 10 and 18, all of whom go to school. She sells fruits and vegetables, and has been running the business for 14 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more carrots, cabbages, and oranges for resale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more carrots, cabbages, and oranges for resale.

loans.name: Nishemiya

texts.en:
Nishemiya is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona Farmers Organization. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Helen, Jessy and Manassah. 

 Before he became a member, Nishemiya had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Nishemiya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40 per cent higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Nishemiya  spoke about his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children and about his hope to eventually make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo mujeres emprendedoras  está en su ciclo número 6 º  del programa de comité de mujeres, lleva este nombre ya que todas las integrantes son muy emprendedoras y luchadoras que quieren salir adelante y es por eso que están esforzándose, además están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Carmen integra este grupo, tiene un modesto salón de belleza que ha ido montando y equipando con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio, se unió a este grupo con mucho entusiasmo y fe de poder crecer e ir mejorando su situación de vida. Carmen es una mujer muy luchadora y emprendedora, que está saliendo adelante por su familia, para poder darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Pide este préstamo para poder equipar su peluquería con productos variados para poder seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes. Quiere comprar tintes, cremas, shampoo, enjuagues, tijeras, peines nuevos y demás. Todas agradecen por esta oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Emprendedoras" group is in its 5th cycle in the women's committee program. They have this name because all the members are very entrepreneurial and hard-working; they want to be successful and therefore they are strengthening themselves. In addition within this program the goal is to eliminate poverty.

Carmen is a member of this group. She has a modest beauty salon that has been opened and equipped with great effort and sacrifice. She joined this group with a lot of enthusiasm and faith to be able to grow and improve her life situation. Carmen is a very hard-working and enterprising woman who is helping her family get ahead and to be able to give them everything she could not have.

She seeks this loan to be able to equip her salon with various products to be able to continue giving good service to her customers. She wants to buy dyes, creams, shampoos, rinses, scissors, new combs, and other items.

Everyone is thankful for this opportunity that they are receiving.

loans.use: to buy dyes, creams, shampoos, rinses, scissors, new combs, and other items.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Monica, a 36-year-old mother who is very kind, loving, and charming. She is based in Kapcheno, a remote village in the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. She is happily married and has two children that depend on her for their basic needs. For the past five years, she has been involved in mixed farming on her small piece of land. Her major primary sources of income are egg selling, crops, and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. She passionately loves poultry farming, and when asked what is most enjoyable about poultry farming, her response was “feeding my poultry.” 

She sells eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market. Because of high quality eggs, customers have been streaming into her compound, and the demand has been overwhelming. To be able to meet the demand, she is requesting a loan to buy additional poultry. Through the loan, she will buy quality breeds of poultry that have high productivity, and hence, satisfy the demand that is there. 

The increased income level will be used in improving her living conditions, and she plans on expanding her business to other towns. Other than increased profits, she will also benefit from the poultry manure, which will be used in her vegetable garden to increase productivity. Increased profits will make her business flourish, and hence, provide a secure solid education to her children.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Yahuza

texts.en:
Yahuza is a maize farmer from Gabas village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yahuza would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yahuza can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Yahuza, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Josianne

texts.en: Josianne is 25 years old. She is married with one child who has 3 years.  She sells foodstuffs and has been selling in a business for three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more potatoes, beans and rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes, beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta, 31, resides in Dasmarinas, Cavite, in the Philippines. She is married to Saidamin, a vendor, and has children. She and her husband work hard to provide for their family and to support their children's schooling.

Julieta is in the food business. She has operated a food stall for 10 years. In the Philippines, a food stall is a common sight, especially in populated areas. People in the working class usually buy their meals at food stalls, where food is sold at reasonable prices. They buy for the convenience and to save money, because it costs more to cook at home. They just eat their homecooked meals at the end of the day with their families. 

Julieta is good cook, which is why her food stall is popular with neighbours and the local working community, who serve as her regular customers. She is also a dealer of cellular phones, a business that her husband manages. She earns a minimum net income of 2,000 Philippine pesos per day.

To help her maintain her business, Julieta is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy additional raw ingredients, such as pork, fish, chicken and seasonings that are needed for her cooking. Her income from her food stall helps cover the family's daily living expense and her children's schooling. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that she will recieve. 

Julieta dreams of building her business to secure the education of her children. She wants her children to finish their studies until college, to get good jobs and uplift their lives. She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy fresh meat, vegetables, oil and other ingredients needed for her food stall.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit, 27, lives in the village of Shikahogh, in the Syunik Region of Armenia. He graduated from the Kapan State Medical College and specialized as a dental technician, but he has never managed to work in his area of specialty.

For some time, he worked as a guard at the factory and now he works as a distributor at the bread factory. Davit is just married and still has no children. He lives with his wife and his father; his mother died several years ago. 

Davit and his father run a farm. Davit takes care of cows, calves, sheep, rabbits and chickens and also has a large plot of land on which he has established an orchard. He grows apples, peaches, plums, nuts, cornel and mulberries. He also cultivates potatos, tomatoes and cucumbers. During the week, Davit sells little by little at the city’s wholesale market.

Davit will be greatly happy to receive this loan, which he wants to use to purchase fodder for his farm cattle, so that he will have enough stored fodder for the cattle during all three months of winter.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Boqueron 2 Group

texts.es:
Boqueron 2 esta en su Segundo ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, por lo que están luchando y esforzándose.
Una de ellas es la señora Vicenta, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir que debe seguir trabajando para mejorar. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas varias y frescas, y pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas frescas para la venta, y seguir de esta forma con su trabajo.
texts.en:
"Boqueron 2" is in its second lending cycle of the Women's Committee program, in which everyone promised to work to help each other to get ahead. They are participating in the poverty elimination survey, so they are struggling and trying hard.

One of them is Señora Vicenta, who in her survey showed a poverty level within level one; that is, she must continue working to improve. She earns her living selling a variety of fresh fruits; she is requesting this loan to be able to purchase fresh fruit to sell in order to continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruit to sell

loans.name: Proscovia

texts.en:
Proscovia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, who all attend school. She is not looking after any other family member. She rents a house with access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

Proscovia has been selling raw food and vegetables at retail in the market for the last three years. She works days a week. She does not have any other source of income. Her challenges include seasonality and transportation. 

She has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO. She joined MCDT-SACCO  because of the relatively low interest charged on loans. This loan will enable her to stock more green bananas, different yams, cabbages, onions, potatoes (both sweet and Irish) and vegetables to sell. 

Her dream is to buy a van to ease her transportation challenges.

loans.use: To buy cassava, sweet potatoes, onions and cabbages

loans.name: Anivic Group

texts.en:
Norie, 56, is the featured borrower from the Anivic group. She is standing in the middle in the photograph.

She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua. The group members have been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to work in Lebanon and earn better incomes to support their beloved ones back in the Philippines.

Norie is married and the mother of two children. She is working hard as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved kids and improve their living conditions. She is acquiring this loan to pay her children's school tuition fees.

As for the other group members, Grace is on the right, and Beth is standing on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plantains, yucca, cracklings, bags, and oil, among other products

loans.name: San Blas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Blas,  está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas tienen el propósito de poder crecer y mejorar sus vidas, quieren capacitarse y mejorar cada día.
La Sra. Fulvia es la presidenta de este grupo, ella es empleada, y también se dedica al cultivo, comenta que pide este préstamo para la preparación y mejoramiento del suelo para el cultivo de productos agrícolas, así como: poroto, mandioca, maíz, batata, etc., las mismas las aprovechará para el comercio y el consumo, de esta manera podrá seguir ayudando a su familia.
Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder crecer y mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
The San Blas group is in it's first cycle of the women's committee program, where everyone has the intention of growing and improving their lives.  They want to enable themselves and improve further every day.

Fulvia is the president of this group.  She is employed, and she also makes a living growing crops.  She  is asking for this loan to prepare and improve the soil for the planting of agricultural products such as beans, manioc, corn, and sweet potato, among other things.  She will sell the harvest and also use it for personal consumption so that she can continue to help her family.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving to be able to grow and improve her life.

loans.use: to prepare and improve the land for planting

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla, now 40 years old, used her previous loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds for planting in her farm. It was profitable and she was able to repay the loan.  

She plans to use this loan to boost her farming by buying farm inputs such as animal feed for her livestock, seeds and fertilizer for planting in her farm. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her farming methods. 

This is her third loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loans successfully. Her future hopes are to grow her farming business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy animal feed, fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
María Salmerón es una mujer de admirar, pues hace unos años, esta mujer de 33 años de edad culminó sus estudios de psicología clínica, carrera que seleccionó porque para ella es una profesión de calidad humana, donde puede apoyar a un sin número de personas. Esta mujer multifacética es madre soltera de un hijo de seis años de edad y tiene su trabajo en una clínica, donde se está realizando profesionalmente.
Actualmente María quiere seguir escalando profesionalmente, por lo que está solicitando un préstamo para pagar una maestría en gerencia y liderazgo centrados en calidad. Esto no solo enriquecerá sus conocimientos, sino que también podrá brindar un desempeño laboral de calidad. Ella sueña llegar a la gerencia de su trabajo, pues donde está siente que ha recibido mucho apoyo y es donde ha entregado todo de sí.
texts.en:
María Salmerón is a woman to admire. A few years ago, this 33 year old woman finished her clinical psychology studies, a career she selected because she wanted a profession that dealt with the human condition, where she can help a number of people. This multifaceted woman is a single mother of one 6-year old son. She works in a clinic professionally.

Today Maria wants to continue growing professionally, so she seeks a loan to pay for a masters degree in quality management and leadership. This will not only enrich her knowledge, but also she will be able to provide quality services. She dreams of being the manager of her work, as where she is now she has received a lot of support and it is where she has dedicated herself to her work.

loans.use: to pay for a masters degree in quality management and leadership.

loans.name: Mawate

texts.fr: Âgée de 29ans, Mawaté habite actuellement le quartier Agoè. Chrétienne, Elle vie en couple dans une location où elle utilise la devanture pour son petit commerce d’ignames. Mawaté s’approvisionne dans le marché de Bassar, une ville située au nord du Togo. Pendant cette période de bon marché des ignames, elle sollicite un crédit pour maximiser son approvisionnement afin d’augmenter son bénéfice.
texts.en: Mawaté, aged 29, currently lives in the Agoè district. A Christian woman, she lives as a couple in a place where she uses the entryway for her small-scale commerce involving yams. Mawaté gets her supplies from the market in Bassar, a town located in northern Togo. The time is right in the market for low-priced yams, and she is requesting a loan to maximize her supply in order to increase her profit.

loans.use: to purchase 2 calabashes of yams

loans.name: Tisungane Group

texts.en: A mother of four children, Idah sells tyres and rims in her community, as one of her main sources of income. She runs this business in order to find adequate funds for supporting her family, by providing them with basic needs and paying their medical bills. She will use the loan to buy more hardware materials such as tyres, rims and pedals ,in order to expand her business. She hopes to increase her business space and dreams of building a permanent dwelling house. There has been a positive change since she started obtaining the loans, as she now built her own house and she is able to send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy rims and tyres

loans.name: Sasun

texts.en:
This young man is 25 years old and he lives in Kapan City in the Syunik region. Sasun is not married and he is the single son of his parents. He lives with his parents; his mother is housewife and his father works as a locksmith. Sasun graduated Yerevan State Institute of Physical Education the department of Athletics, and now he has a specialty in coaching pedagogy. It has already been four years and he works at a school in his specialty as a coach. Sasun decided to do repairs on their house and he wants to end that work by the New Year’s holidays. 
Sasun asks for a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams in order to buy electric wires and some construction materials in order to end all the started repair works on his house quickly and on time.

loans.use: to buy electric wires and some construction materials.

loans.name: Adjovi  Jeannette

texts.fr:
Cette année 2014, Adjovi Jeannette a 23 ans d’âge et 3 ans d’expériences dans la vente des vernis sous un hangar pas très loin de son domicile. Elle vend 7 jours sur 7 entre 7h30 et 18h et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé deux fois par mois par manque de moyen financier..
Elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter 12 douzaine de vernis claire et 5 douzaine de vernis M.A.C.K afin d’augmenter son stock afin de pouvoir satisfaire ces clients.
texts.en: This year 2014, Adjovi Jeannette is 23 years old and has three years of experience selling fingernail polish in a shed not far from her home. She makes her sales seven days a week from 7:30 AM to 6 PM. She gets her supplies at the Grand Market of Lomé twice a month due to a lack of financial means. She is requesting this loan to purchase 12 dozen of clear nail polish and 5 dozen of M.A.C.K nail polish in order to increase her stock, so as to be able to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to purchase 12 dozen of clear nail polish and 5 dozen of M.A.C.K nail polish.

loans.name: Alh. Usaini

texts.en: Alh. Usaini is a maize farmer from Gabas village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Alh. Usaini would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to provide for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alh. Usaini can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Alh. Usaini, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing.

loans.name: Gila

texts.en:
Gila is 59 years old and a married woman who has five children. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Gila has been breeding cattle and cows for the past 24 years. She was a housewife, but her husband is unemployed, and her business helps to cover family needs. 

Gila usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, and then resells them for a profitable price in the livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is 220 AZN (Azerbaijani new manat), and this business is the only source of financial income in her family. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan, and people use it in everyday dishes, like pilau and dolma. 

Gila also keeps milking cows for personal use and for selling milk to neighbors. She wants to expand her business and improve the life conditions of her family. She applied for a loan of 500 AZN. She plans to purchase one milking cow with her loan funds. This will be her fifth loan, and she has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase one milking cow

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is grateful that she was granted a 50,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan which she used to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her ornamental business. Through her earnings she was able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would now like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy fertilizer and farm inputs (seedlings), pots, wires and net she needs for growing her ornamentals to sell. It will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial assistance that will be given to her. She wishes everyone a blessed Christmas!

Josefina dreams to grow and be more successful in her ornamental farm. She aims to improve their quality of life and prays for healthy living. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for gardening materials such as wire, baskets and supplies like seeds and fertilizer needed in her business.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es: La señora Florencia, vive y trabaja en Sacaba, económicamente es independiente, emprendedora y responsable; se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir para mujeres (polleras y blusas), compra materia prima(tela) al por mayor y costura según los pedidos que tiene que entregar para cada semana, especialmente para las fiestas religiosas o patronales y algunos acontecimientos sociales propios de los lugares aledaños. La señora Florencia requiere un crédito para la compra de telas e insumos de confección para incrementar su nivel de produccion y en consecuencia mejorar sus ingresos en beneficio de su familia para tener mejor situación social.
texts.en:
Florencia lives and works in Sacaba. She's economically independent, an entrepreneur and responsible. She earns a living making women's clothing (skirts and blouses). 

She buys raw material (fabric) in bulk and sews for the orders she must submit each week, especially for religious festivals and some social events in the surrounding areas. 

Florencia needs a loan to buy fabric and production inputs to increase her production level and consequently improve her income to benefit her family so they can have a better social situation.

loans.use: to purchase apparel fabrics and materials to increase her level of production and consequently improve her income for the benefit of her family.

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr:
Agée de 38ans, Madame Dédé est mariée et mère 3 enfants. Elle vit dans le quartier Adidogomè où elle vend à la devanture de sa maison des produits d’alimentation général. 
Elle s’approvisionne dans le grand marché de Lomé 4 fois par mois. Elle a une longueur d’avance sur la concurrence grâce à l’accueil client, ce qui lui a permit d'avoir une clientèle importante et exigeante qui la pousse à solliciter ce crédit.
texts.en: Ms. Dédé, aged 38, is a married mother of three. She lives in the Adidogomè district, where she sells grocery items in front of her house. She gets her supplies from the Grand Market of Lomé four times a month. She has a head start on the competition, thanks to customer accommodations affording her a significant and demanding customer base, which compels her to request this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a container of oil and 50 pouches of tomatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: 15 Corazones Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado 15 Corazones está en su ciclo número 12, son 20 integrantes, que se están esforzando por poder crecer y salir adelante. Todas ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, para conocer su situación y conforme a ello poder trabajar por mejorar.
La Sra. Beti es parte de este grupo, ella tiene una heladería, en la que le va muy bien pues ya tiene muy buena clientela, le va bien ya que en el país se tiene un clima muy cálido por lo que tiene mucha venta. Es una mujer muy emprendedora y luchadora que se está esforzando por poder crecer y salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar una buena variedad de helados, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas, y cubrir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group is called 15 Corazones and they are in their 12th loan cycle. There are 20 members who are putting a lot of effort to move forward and succeed.  They are all participating in the eliminate poverty survey to find out their own situation and accordingly work to improve themselves.

Beti is part of this group. She has an ice cream shop that is doing very well because she already has a good clientele. It is also going well because the country has a warm climate and therefore sales are good. She is an entrepreneur and hard-working woman who is putting a lot of effort to grow and succeed. She asks for this loan to buy a good variety of ice creams in order to continue to sell and meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy a variety of ice creams to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is grateful that she was granted a 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan, which she used to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her ornamental plant business. Through her earnings, she was able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 

She would now like to apply for a new 10,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy fertilizer, pots, plastics, wires and net she needs for growing healthy ornamental plants to sell. It will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial assistance that will be given to her. She wishes everyone a blessed Christmas!

Editha dreams to grow her ornamental farm. She hopes for a prosperous and and quiet life for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, seeds and other materials for her ornamental-plant-growing business.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is thankful that she was granted a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan, which she used to buy fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her tailoring business. Through her earnings she was able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 

She would like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy more fabric, thread and other materials needed in sewing curtains, table covers and mats and school uniforms. She is excited to meet the pre-Christmas orders for new curtains and table covers. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her, for it will surely help cover their everyday living. She wishes everyone a blessed Christmas!

Melinda hopes to buy additional sewing machines and hire people to have a bigger tailoring business. She dreams of a prosperous and peaceful life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Yawa, est une femme âgée de 56 ans; Mère d’un enfant habitant, en couple dans le quartier Wonyomé à Adidogomè un quartier de Lomé. Depuis 1969, elle s’est lancée dans la vente de la bouillit et des baignés à base de la farine de blé. 
Avec deux personnes recrutées au sein de l’activité, Yawa est une entreprenante qui vend sept jour sur sept et de 5h30 à 10h30 ; son but actuel est d’augmenter la quantité de production des deux activités, pour cette raison elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter un sac de Maïs et de farine de blé.
texts.en: Yawa, a 56-year-old woman, is a mother of one child. She and her husband live in the Wonyomé district of Adidogomè. Since 1969, she has been selling porridge, as well as wheat-flour beignets. With two persons recruited to help in her business, Yawa is enterprising, selling seven days a week from 5:30 to 10:30 AM; her current goal is to increase her production of both products. For this reason, she is requesting this loan to purchase a sack of corn and a sack of wheat flour.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of corn and a sack of wheat flour

loans.name: Elizamin

texts.en:
Elizamin is a 38-year-old married man and has three kids. His family is IDP (Internally Displaced Persons), and they live in an IDP settlement. His wife is a housekeeper. Elizamin has been raising livestock, such as sheep and cows, for twelve years. He sells milk, meat, and sheep wool at the local bazaar and earns 230 AZN monthly.

The region where he lives is very cold in winter. That’s why people’s demand for wool is very high. They make coats, jackets, gloves, and socks to keep themselves warm. People use meat to prepare dishes every day and drink milk because it is very useful for health.

Elizamin wants to increase his income because his current earnings are not enough to cover life’s demands. He applied for a 1,000 AZN loan in order to buy more livestock.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Hello, lenders. Meet Everlyne, a very industrious, honest and hardworking woman from the Nandihills area of Kenya, near the famous Rift valley.
