loans.use: to buy more mats, brooms and cases for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase good quality mirrors and wood, along with packs of polish and nails in larger quantities.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a married Ugandan man living in Masindi. He sells beer and sodas in his depot. Edward earns a salary to boost his income. He has been in business for one year, and due to the demand of his family's needs, he decided to start up the business. He wants to educate his children even though poor roads hinder transportation for his business. He wants a loan to to buy more beer and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer and sodas to sell

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine is 31 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 4 and 12 years old, all of whom go to school.  

Francine has a shop and has been in business for 5 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cooking oil, rice, lotion and sugar to resell. 

The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, rice, lotion and sugar to resell.

loans.name: Zhyldyz

texts.en:
Zhyldyz is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of International and Comparative Politics. Here is her story:

“My name is Zhyldyz. I am 18 years old and one of the graduates of AUCA’s New Generation Academy. I was selected as a student who had good scores and was in need of financial aid, so was awarded a full scholarship for one year of study at this program. New Generation Academy opened my eyes and gave me new hope for a bright future, and belief in myself. 

In summer I successfully passed AUCA’s entrance exams and became a freshman. I have a lot of responsibility in my studies as my parents have to pay for them. AUCA professors use modern education technologies, develop critical thinking skills, share their knowledge and experience, and create a very friendly atmosphere. AUCA is a student's dream university, but not everyone can afford it.

My family consists of six people: my grandmother, my parents, me and two siblings, who are studying at school. My grandmother is retired and helps my mother to take care of my siblings. My father is a history teacher by trade but is unemployed due to his eye disease. Therefore my mother is the only provider in my family. She doesn’t know what it is to be tired and does her best to earn more money. Due to increasing living costs, my family’s income is not enough anymore even to satisfy my family's needs. 

I am not indifferent to my family’s situation. I believe that, “A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step”. I am asking Kiva lenders for a favour with the first step. Then I am sure that I can and I will make the next steps myself in order to be able to contribute to a better standard of living.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Danilo Fernando

texts.es:
Sam Miguel de los Bancos un Cantón de clima cálido húmedo lleno de gente amable y trabajadora tradicionalmente se realiza las festividades por el aniversario del mismo, este Cantón es un atractivo turístico muy visitado por su variedad de flora y fauna silvestre, en los feriados de carnaval que se realizan todos los años aquí en este Cantón toda su gente se dirige a la cascada del amor a pasar un momento agradable en familia.
En este Cantón vive y trabaja el señor Danilo un hombre luchador de 31 años es soltero no tiene hijos vive con sus padres, trabaja como guía de turistas, solicita este crédito Para invertir en emprender un negocio, emprenderá en un restaurante, ofrecerá servicio de alimentación y paseos en los senderos que tiene en sus propiedad, tiene mucho conocimiento sobre el negocio a emprender ya que por su trabajo ha tenido la oportunidad de conocer varios sitios que son visitados por turistas y conoce bastante de los gustos que ellos tienen y justo eso desea ofrecer a sus visitantes. 
Con esta nueva inversión mejoraran sus ingresos económicos y pronto podrá dejar de trabajar y dedicarse solo a su negocio, el señor Danilo agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos is a canton with a rainy climate, full of kind, hardworking people who traditionally celebrate its anniversary festivities. This canton is an attractive tourist spot much visited for its variety of flora and fauna and the carnival festivities which take place every year here in this canton. Everyone heads to the waterfall of love to spend some quality time with family.

Danilo lives and works in this canton, a tenacious man of 31 years old who has no children and lives with his parents. He works as a tourist guide. He is requesting this loan to invest in starting a business. He will open a restaurant, offering food services and walks along the trails which he has on his property. He has a lot of knowledge about the business he is undertaking, as through his work he has had the opportunity to visit many sites that are visited by tourists and knows much of their tastes and that is exactly what he wants to offer his visitors.

With this new loan he will improve his income and soon he will be able to leave his job and dedicate himself to his business. Danilo is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the support and the opportunity offered.

loans.use: to start a restaurant offering food and walks on the trails.

loans.name: Sandra Johana

texts.es:
Sandra de 22 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene 2 hijos, estudió hasta 9° grado de educación básica, debido a que su madre no pudo pagar más sus estudios, se crió con su madre, su padre las abandono cuando apenas tenía tres años de edad. Actualmente trabaja duro con su pareja para mantenerse.

Sandra es comerciante de ropa desde hace un año, es su única fuente de ingresos y con la que ha colaborado a mantener a su familia. Solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa de damas y caballeros, debido a una enfermedad tuvo que gastarse el dinero de su negocio por lo que va a volver a empezar. Sueña con fortalecer su negocio para que a su hijo no le falte el estudio.
texts.en:
Sandra is 22 years old, she has a partner and 2 children. She studied up until 9th grade of basic education because her mother could no longer pay for her studies. She grew up with her mother, her father left them when she was barely three years old. Now her and her partner work hard to support themselves. 
Sandra has been selling clothes for a year. It is her only source of income and it contributes to supporting her family. She is asking for this loan to buy clothes for women and men. Due to an illness she had to spend all of the money for her business so now she needs to start again. She dreams of strengthening her business so that her children do not miss out on their studies.

loans.use: to buy clothes for men and women.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 49-year-old, married woman. She has 5 children, and one of her sons is shown in the photo. 

For three years now her son has been involved in business selling different items including biscuits, candies, toffees, etc. He sells biscuits door-to-door and in the local market. He serves well in his community, and he is earning enough to meet the basic expenses of his family. 

However now he needs to earn more to meet the increasing expenditures of his family, including his parents. Therefore Kousar has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR for her son to buy stock of biscuits, cookies and sweets in large quantity to increase sales and hence profits.

loans.use: to buy stock of biscuits, cookies and sweets in large quantity to increase sales and hence profits.

loans.name: Migdonia

texts.es:
Migdonia, de 56 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado de educación básica, es madre soltera, sus tres hijos ya están acompañados y tienen sus propios hogares, con ella solo vive su mamá y es quien depende de ella.-  

Migdonia, trabaja con ganado de repasto, lo ha hecho por más de cinco años y lo aprendió de unos vecino que fueron quienes le enseñaron, decidió hacerlo a pesar de ser un trabajo que por lo general lo realizan hombres, buscando de ésta manera un mayor ingreso económico.

Se dedica además, a la venta de ropa en los cantones, antes trabajaba como empleada doméstica, la distancia que camina para ir a vender es de 1 kilómetro, y este trabajo lo realiza tres veces por semana.-

Migdonia, utilizará el crédito para comprar ganado de repasto, ella espera continuar trabajando de esta manera y en un futuro tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Ella sueña con darle mejores condiciones alimentarias y otras comodidades a su mamá para que sus días sean agradables.
texts.en:
Fifty-six-year-old Migdonia has a sixth grade education. She is a single mother to three children, who are now adults and have their own partners and homes. The only person who lives with and depends on Migdonia is her mother.

Migdonia works with grazing cattle. She has been doing it for more than five years, having been taught the trade by some neighbours. Migdonia started to work in this trade - despite the fact that it is male-dominated work - in order to earn a higher income.

She used to work as a domestic servant but, now, in addition to working with cattle, Migdonia works selling clothes. She has to walk one kilometre to get to her work. She sells clothes three times per week.

Migdonia will use this loan to buy grazing cattle. She hopes to continue with this work and, in the future, enjoy a higher quality of life.

Migdonia dreams of giving her mother better food to eat and other comforts so that her days are more pleasant.

loans.use: to buy grazing cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to look after plantain and avocado crops.

loans.name: Jose Reinaldo

texts.es:
José de 55 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos, uno vive en el extranjero y el otro con él. Estudió hasta 9° grado de educación básica, luego tomó la decisión de trabajare para ayudar en los gastos del hogar, Su esposa es ama de casa y solo ella y su hijo viven con él.

José es agricultor desde muy pequeño le gusto trabajar, empezó con un señor a quien le trabajaba como jornalero, después heredó de su padre un terreno en el que tiene sembrado 10,000 mts cuadrados de maíz y 10,000 mts cuadrados de jícama, también es comerciante de ganado.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar dos bueyes que le servirán para cosechar su cultivo debido a que donde los tiene no hay acceso de vehículos. Sueña con mejorar su vivienda para vivir más cómodo con su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 55 years old, married with two children. One of them lives abroad, the other lives with him. He studied up to the 9th grade of primary education, then he made the decision to work to help with the household expenses. His wife is a homemaker and it's just her and his son who live with him.

Jose is a farmer, he liked to work from a young age. He started with a man who worked as a day laborer, later he inherited his father's land which he has planted with 10,000m2 of corn and 10,000m2 of jicama [yams], he is also a cattle trader.

He is requesting a loan to buy two oxen which will help him to harvest his land, as there is no vehicular access where he has them. He dreams of improving his house to live more comfortably with his family.

loans.use: to buy two oxen.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
José de 64 años de edad, está casado y tiene siete hijos ya mayores, independientes y con hogar propio. No tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, su esposa es ama de casa y solo ella vive con él. José es productor ganadero desde hace 20 años, aprendió de esta actividad trabajando con su padre cuando esta murió se dedicó por completo al ver que le daba muy buenos resultados.

Solicite el préstamo para comprar el alimento del ganado para el verano, él lo prepara con la hoja del cultivo de maíz, pero también va a comprar harinas. Piensa comprar más ganado y espera CrediCampo le apoye.
texts.en:
Jose is 64 years old, married and has seven children who are already grown, independent and have their own homes. He didn't have the opportunity to study, his wife is a homemaker and only she lives with him. Jose has been a cattle rancher for 20 years. He learnt this trade working with his father. When he died, he devoted himself to it entirely because he saw it gave good results.

He is requesting this loan to buy summer feed for his cattle. He makes it with leaves from his corn fields, but he is also going to buy feed. He is thinking of buying more cattle and he hopes CrediCampo will support him.

loans.use: to buy summer feed for his cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Siridi Sai Group

texts.en:
Kariman, about 51 years old, is a widow woman from Titilagarh town of Balangir district in Odisha, India. She belongs to a Muslim community and resides in a slum area with her two sons and daughters-in-law. The lady standing second from left with her hand raised in the photo is Kariman. She is a very headstrong, confident lady who is heading her five-member family.  

After the death of her husband, Kariman faced a lot of difficulties in maintaining her family. So she decided to go for an income source and for the last 10 years, she has been running a garment business in her house itself. Apart from that, she has been running a tailoring unit with two sewing machines. She takes orders for stitching of ladies garments from her locality. Her elder son helps her in this business. Her younger son is working in an auto repair center. Kariman earns a monthly income of 5,000 INR from the above businesses, which is very little to manage her family. She is very much worried about the future of her sons and she never wants to see her family in trouble. Therefore, she wants to earn some more income by expanding her business for the secure future of her sons. To materialize her dream, Kariman, along with the other seven like-minded women of her locality formed a Self Help Group to avail a loan from Mahashakti Foundation.  

With the present loan, she wants to purchase ready-made garments, a pico machine and some cloth for stitching of ladies garments. She hopes this will help her to increase her income and will help her. Kariman hopes to save enough money for taking a permanent cabin to shift her garment shop to the road side, which will be managed by her elder son and start an independent auto repair center for her younger son. Among the other seven members, four members are running a  Tiffin stall in a push cart, one member is doing a dry food making and selling business, one member is doing a fancy item vending business and the last one is doing carpentry work.

loans.use: To purchase ready-made garments, a pico machine and some cloth for stitching ladies garments.

loans.name: Maqsoda

texts.en: Maqsoda is a 51-year-old vigorous lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to the lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of Rs 40,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she is able to generate a healthier source of income. She is on her third loan and thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues

loans.name: Gouri Sss Group

texts.en:
Kamal is one of the members in the group Gouri Sss. Her group is located in the rural area of Chhindwara district of Madhya Pradesh, India. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and her two children. Her most difficult challenge was to finish studying for her higher secondary education.

Kamal is excited to be taking her first loan with Kiva field partner, Peoples Forum, after having successfully joined with and grew her business. Kamal and her husband run a General store, which they started almost eight years ago when Kamal's husband took a room for rent at a near market. He decided to get more at a low cost and provide basic household items and cosmetics to the community. 

Now, with this loan, she will purchase a refrigerator to sell perishable ready-made food. Kamal is excited to buy the refrigerator and to add food items in her general store. Her dream is to have a successful business. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a big refrigerator to sell perishable ready-made food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cement and bricks to build a new room inside the house.

loans.name: Mbeneka

texts.en:
Mbeneka is now 47 years old.  She use her previous loan from VisionFund to buy a generator for pumping water for irrigation to her farm. She also bought fertilizer and it has been profitable. 

She has requested her fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya and she plans to use this loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for planting in her farm. She will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan. 

She has paid back her previous loans successfully and her future hopes are to grow her farming business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for use on her farm.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 26 years old and he has a retail shop which he has been running for two years. He is married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with two children. 

He has requested a loan from VisionFund Kenya and will use this loan to buy more stocks of milk, bread, sugar, flour, rice, cooking oil and detergents to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business. 

This is Peter's second loan from VisionFund Kenya and he has paid back his previous loan successfully. In future he hopes to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy milk, bread, sugar and rice for his shop.

loans.name: Vafa

texts.en:
Vafa is 37 years old. As a married mother of three children, Vafa works hard to support her family and improve their finances. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her  family in the Bilasuvar region. She is a very kind and responsible woman, very social and hardworking. Vafa is a teacher but her salary is not enough to cover the family's needs. Because of that, she also works in agriculture, specifically growing crops and animal husbandry. She  is the only breadwinner in the family.

Vafa has four milking cows with calves, and her fresh milk and dairy products are in great demand among the local residents she sells them to. Vafa's  husband helps her in this business. Her customer base increases every day and therefore she has decided to develop her business. Vafa has turned to Aqroinvest CU for a loan of 1500 AZN to buy mineral fertilizers and two milking cows. She plans to build a big barn with the profits from the loan.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and two milking cows.

loans.name: Terry

texts.en:
Terry is now 53 years old. She used her previous loan to buy cow feed, fertilizer and insecticides for spraying her crops and it has been profitable. 

She has requested a fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya and she plans to use this loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and poultry feed. She will use the anticipated profits to service the loan. 

Terry has repaid her previous loans successfully and her future goals are to educate her children and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and poultry feed.

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en:
Alphonse is 32 years old. He is married with three children aged between 4 and 10 years, all of whom go to school. He has a restaurant and has been in business for 10 years. 

With the loan, Alphonse would like to buy beans, potatoes, banana and maize flour to make more food to resell. The profits from the business will be used for the family's welfare and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy beans, potatoes, banana and maize flour to make more food to resell.

loans.name: Emitiot Interest Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Beatrice, a member of Emitiot Interest Self Help Group. She is twenty-nine years old, married and blessed with four children. She grows potatoes and also sells clothes. Having undergone Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise and financial management, she has learned how to keep proper business records and manage the business effectively. 

She is taking a loan from Kiva, which she intends to use to expand her enterprise by adding more stock of clothes. She hopes her business will thrive thus she will have more income. She plans to use the anticipated profits to boost the business and pay school fees for her children.

She is very grateful to Kiva and Hand in Hand Eastern Africa for the support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a cow shed for his farm.

loans.name: Rosa Claribel

texts.es:
Rosa de 51 años de edad, estudió hasta 4 º grado, su esposo al igual que sus 2 hijos se dedican a la pesca y ella se dedica a comercializar el pescado o marisco que su esposo le trae para la venta.
 
Rosa se dedicó a la venta de marisco desde que era niña, ella lo aprendió de sus padres que al igual que ella se dedican a la comercialización de marisco, la distancia está a 200 metros, aunque algunas veces le toca andar vendiendo o correteándolo.
   
El préstamo que esta solicitado a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar una lancha, ya que ella cuenta con el motor nada más y necesita la lancha para que su esposo salga a pescar y conseguir más pescados, así también ella reduce los gastos de alquiler de lancha que es lo que hace actualmente.

El sueño de Rosa es crecer con su negocio y tener el equipo necesario para poder pescar (lancha, motor, redes, etc.).
texts.en:
Rosa, 51, studied up until the fourth grade. Her husband, as well as their two children, make a living by fishing. She sells the fish or seafood which her husband brings home.

Rosa has been selling seafood since she was a child. She learned about this business from her parents, who also sell seafood. The distance is 200 meters, although she sometimes has to walk or travel around to make sales. 

She is applying for a loan from CREDICAMPO to buy a boat, since she only has a motor and she needs the boat for her husband to go out to fish. She will then also reduce the costs of renting a boat, which is what she currently does.

Rosa's dream is to grow her business and have the necessary equipment for fishing (boat, motor, nets, etc.).

loans.use: to buy a boat because she currently only has a motor and she needs the boat so her husband can go out to fish.

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is a 24-year-old married mother of two children who started working six years ago as a hairdresser from her house to help her husband cover the needs and expenses of their family.

Rana is a hard worker and ambitious lady who always tries to develop her business, as she considers her family as a priority and she makes sacrifices to provide them with a better life. Today, Rana is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to expand her business by buying cosmetics to provide her customers with a better and faster service. She is doing this to pay her children's school tuition fees. 

In the future, Rana hopes to open her own beauty salon to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying cosmetics.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine is 32 years old. She is married with a seven-year-old child who goes to school. Justine is an artist who sells baskets and mats. She has been in business for five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more crafts to resell. The profits from the business will be reinvested and used to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more crafts to resell.

loans.name: Abdullahi

texts.en:
Abdullahi is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Abdullahi would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abdullahi can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked about his goals, Abdullahi expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, make more money  for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase goats to raise and sell.

loans.name: Santos Matilde

texts.es:
Santos de 31 años de edad, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos de 24, 22, 20 y 17 años de edad, solo tres viven con ella por su hija ya hizo su hogar. Estudió hasta 9° grado de educación básica, su esposo trabaja en el campo y solo él y sus hijos viven con ella. Ella es comerciante, tiene más de 10 años de vender yuca frita, enchiladas, pastelitos, refresco y demás, se decidió a este negocio por ser sencillo, fácil, se invierto poco y da muchas ganancias y además porque le gusta mucho. Lo vende de manera ambulante en su comunidad en un horario de 1:00 pm a 5:00 pm. También ayuda a su esposo con las labores agrícolas.

Solicita el préstamo para pagar mano de obra y reparar el techo de su casa que se dañó con las pasadas lluvias además quiere invertir un poco en su negocio. Espera mantener su negocio e incluso ofrecer otros productos.
texts.en:
Santos, 31, is married with four children, ages 17, 20, 22 and 24. Only three of them live with her as her daughter already has a home. She studied up until the ninth grade of basic education. Her husband works in the fields and only he and the children live with her. She is a merchant who has been selling fried yuca, enchiladas, cakes, soft drinks and more for ten years. She went into this business because it was simple and easy. She invested little money and the business earns a good profit. She also really likes it. She travels to make sales in her community from 1:00pm to 5:00pm. She also helps her husband with the farm work.

She is applying for a loan to pay workers and repair the roof her house which was damaged with the past rains. She also wants to invest a little in her business. She hopes to maintain her business and even offer other products.

loans.use: to pay workers and repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a corn mill.

loans.name: Christian

texts.en:
Christian is a 25-year-old single man who has been working manufacturing and selling stones for five years to help in covering the needs and expenses of his family. 

He is a hard worker and an ambitious man who is trying desperately to develop his business. Thus today he is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase his business merchandise with a new granite collection to satisfy his customers needs.

Christian hopes to expand his business, to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with a new granite collection.

loans.name: Emmanuel Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Jane, a member of Emmanuel Women Group. She is forty-four years old, married and blessed with eight children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013.

After undergoing Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on savings, enterprise development and financial management she started a kiosk selling fruits and vegetables such as pawpaws, bananas and kale.

She is borrowing from Kiva to add more stock of fruits and vegetables to enable her to increase her sales thus earn more income. The anticipated income will assist her to cater for her family’s food, clothing and pay school fees for her six school-going children with ease.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy more stock of fruits and vegetables such as kale, pawpaw and bananas.

loans.name: Godofredo

texts.es:
Godofredo, de 30años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado de educación básica, está casado, su esposa trabaja en los oficios domésticos, tiene dos hijos que están estudiando y viven con él, solamente tres personas dependen de él.

Godofredo, trabaja vendiendo diferentes productos en la tienda que tiene , lo ha hecho por más de 3 años y decidió hacerlo buscando un dinero extra para su familia, los fines de semana trabaja en mecánica automotriz, antes trabajaba como empleado en un taller de mecánica.-

El necesita el crédito para comprar productos para la tienda como: gaseosas, golosinas, galletas y otros.- El préstamo mejorará su negocio ya que podrá surtir con más productos.-

El espera cubrir las necesidades de su familia y con esto mejorar su calidad de vida.- El sueña con ver a sus hijos cuando reciban sus títulos universitarios.
texts.en:
Godofredo, 30, studied up until the ninth grade of basic education. He is married and his wife is dedicated to the household duties. He has two children who are studying and live with him. Only three people depend on him.

Godofredo makes a living selling various products in his store. He has had the store for three years. He decided to do this because he was looking for extra money for his family. On the weekends, he works in auto mechanics. Before, he worked as an employee in a mechanic shop.

He needs this loan to buy products for his store, such as soda, candy, cookies, and other items. This loan will improve his business as he will be able to stock it with more products.

He hopes to cover his family's needs and thereby improve their quality of life. He dreams of seeing his children receive university degrees.

loans.use: to buy products for his store, such as soda, candy, cookies, and other items.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is 31 years old. She is married with 2 children aged between 2 and 7; one of them goes to school. 

She has a restaurant and has been in business for 2 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice and bananas to make more food to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: To buy more rice and bananas so as to make more food to sell.

loans.name: Suleman

texts.en:
Suleman is a maize farmer from Tafida village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Suleman would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Suleman can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Suleman, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Sule

texts.en:
Sule is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Sule would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sule can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Like other Babban Gona members, Sule is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing  for his family, and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Fancy

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Fancy, 32 years old, married and blessed with four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to benefit from trainings on enterprise development and financial management. This has improved her knowledge in enterprise management. She has been able to improve her pawpaw farming by keeping accurate records and using the profits to expand the business further. 

Fancy is taking a Kiva loan to expand her farming by buying more planting seeds and manure to help improve on yield. She hopes this will lead to bounty harvest hence more sales leading to more income. She plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees and buy clothes for her children.

Fancy highly appreciates the support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy more planting seeds and manure.

loans.name: Kazindoro Tukore Group

texts.en:
Midius (in a skirt and green jacket) is a member Kazindoro Tukore Group. She is a resident of Nyamiyaga cell, Rukungiri district. She deals in sales of second hand clothes as her major sources of income and she is a mother of 3 children. 

She joined Ugafode in a group to secure a loan of 800,000 UGX to boost her business. She has been using her capital to run her business but later she found out that she couldn’t sustain her business so she joined Ugafode for financial assistance. The loan will help her to buy new stock of used clothing that will attract customers buying clothes for the festive season. 

Midius thanks Ugafode for financial assistance which has improved peoples' standards of living her area.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Sumayiya

texts.en:
Sumayiya lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, both attend school. She is also looking after her brothers' children. 

She is a poultry farmer. She has operated her business from home for the last two years, working seven days a week.

She has requested for a loan of Ugandan shillings 200,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy poultry feeds and vaccines. Her challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her dream is to build more buildings to expand her poultry farming.

She lives in her own house with access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy poultry feeds and vaccines.

loans.name: Ricklin

texts.en:
Ricklin is a single lady aged 22 years living in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

She operates a retail shop, bar and rentals to supplement her incomes. She ventured into business in order to be self-employed. She dreams of buying land where she can build a home. 

She will use the loan facility to buy beers, sugar and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy beers, sugar, soap and rice to sell.

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en:
The humid and rocky Mogogosiek area within the Litein area of Kenya can be considered a hardship area. Even with savannah plains and little human activity, there exists a farm that stands tall, a farm with over 2 high-pedigreed Friesian cows, producing over 30 litres of milk. It’s quite an outstanding feat, considering the harsh terrain and other handicaps, like the lack of electricity from the national grid and also because of being dependent on traditional methods of harvesting water. 

Kiva lenders, meet Godwin, the man credited with the success story of the farm. He is a loving husband and has been farming for the past 10 years. Godwin passionately loves dairy farming, and this can be attested to by the fact that he knows his cows, each individually, because he works with them twice a day, 365 days a year. He and his wife have even named one of them “Birirmet”. Because he loves the cows, he runs his operation by four simple rules that have kept him and his herd happy. The rules are: breed them well, feed them well, clean them well and milk them well. His primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops and some personal business that he engages in to make ends meet. 

The income he makes from selling milk, eggs and crops is insufficient to meet his family's expenses, but he has still kept hope alive that he will improve. He is seeking a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a quality dairy cow. 

Juhudi Kilimo serves poor smallholder farmers in Kenya. This is a severely marginalized group with little access to financial services. By extending credit to the farmers, Juhudi helps them acquire assets like dairy cows, poultry, irrigation equipment, and greenhouses. Through this loan from Kiva lenders Godwin will buy not just an ordinary cow but a quality breed of cow that will be producing between 10-20 litres of milk a day. The additional milk will result in additional income and hence improved living conditions. The income generated from selling the milk will be used to fully repay the loan, and will also go towards the education of his children. He will also benefit from the cow manure which will be used to increase the fertility level of his farm, hence increasing productivity. Through the loan he will also be able to build a bio-gas digester that will be helpful in saving energy. 

This loan will completely change his life and improve his living conditions. Godwin waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a good quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle so as to work as a driver.

loans.name: Alhaji Zailani

texts.en: Alhaji Zailani is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Zailani would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate needs. When asked about his goals, Alhaji Zailani expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, ensure his children, Murtala, Aliyu and Nana, are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Jane, thirty years old, married and blessed with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013.

Jane runs a maize flour selling business. She buys maize from local farmers which she mills using her posho mill and sells the maize flour to her customers. She has been trained by Hand in Hand Eastern Africa on enterprise creation, business record keeping and financial management. These skills have helped her run the enterprise well and profitably.  

She is taking a Kiva loan to expand her enterprise by purchasing maize stock since there is a high demand for flour in her locality. This will help her get more income to support her basic family needs and provide education for her children. 

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support; she promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy more maize that will be milled so she can meet the high demand for maize flour.

loans.name: Upendo Gataro Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Agnes, married and blessed with nine children. Her economic activity is farming maize and beans and also she does poultry keeping. 

The training from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa on enterprise development and financial management has enabled her manage her business well. She needs a loan to buy farm inputs such as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to help improve on crop yield. She hopes that the income level from her business will increase so as to meet family needs such as school fees, clothing and food.

Agnes  is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: To pay for farm inputs such as hybrid seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the money float for transfer and credit cards.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Meet Peter. He is a forty-nine-year-old smallholder farmer from Kongoni village in the Kitale area of Kenya. Like most farmers in the region, Peter practices mixed farming. He keeps dairy animals and grows maize among other crops. He has been doing this work for a decade now. Over the years, he has come to like farming because it is a sustainable and self-fulfilling investment. Farming doesn’t take all his time, so he is also able to attend to his “side hustle” job. A delicate balance of both jobs has enabled him to comfortably raise his six children. Peter is seeking a loan to buy poultry and build a chicken coop. He is ready to get into commercial production of meat, eggs and, perhaps, feathers. This business is very profitable but it does not require a licence, a big space or product marketing. There is an established market for poultry products in almost all places around the world. Besides, chickens will bring many non-monetary benefits to Peter’s farm. Chickens will be great for his farm's compost because their poop is high in nitrogen; in free-range, they will naturally forage by scratching soil looking for bugs, which aerates the soil and breaks up vegetation for decomposition. Peter will also use your money to build a chicken coop in order to make the raising of chickens easier. By putting all the chickens in one place, he can feed them consistently, track each one of them easily and more easily manage and collect eggs and manure. The coop will contain water containers and laying boxes for the health, comfort and safety of the chickens. When Juhudi Kilimo’s loan officer asked Peter how his family will benefit from the loan, he replied, “they will benefit from the income I get once I acquire the loan and buy the asset.”

loans.use: to buy poultry and build a chicken coop

loans.name: Shitu

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet a single parent with four children, who operates a retail shop alongside a bar business for extra income. She started this business four years ago and has managed to look after her children using the proceeds. She is a hard working woman who is fighting hard for increased sales and profits this festive season, when demand will be high. She wants to buy land and build a house for her children as a loving mother. Annet plans to buy rice, sodas and beers to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy rice, sodas and beers to sell ahead of Christmas.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 41-year-old married mother of two children. Due to the low financial situation of her husband, she started six years ago selling clothes to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Mariam is a hard worker who has a good reputation among her customers. 

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of winter clothes to satisfy her customers' needs, especially for the upcoming Christmas.

Mariam hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of winter clothes

loans.name: Maria Candelaria

texts.es:
María de 58 años de edad, es madre soltera de cinco hijos, estudió hasta 2°grado de educación básica, vive con tres de sus hijos y dos nietos que están estudiando. Ella se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de ganado en esta actividad le apoyan sus hijos; tiene 34 años de experiencia trabajando de esta manera,  también tiene una tienda en su casa. Para llegar a la parcela donde siembra camina 5 minutos y trabaja de 7:00 am a 10:00 am todos los días en época de siembra.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar fertilizante para su cultivo de maíz, prepara terreno para sembrar ajonjolí y cosechar el cultivo que está listo. Sueña con ver preparados a sus nitos y con mejorar las condiciones de su casa.
texts.en:
58-year old María is the single mother of five children. She has a grade 2 education. Three of her children and two grandchildren who attend school live with her. 

María earns her living from agriculture and raising animals. Her children help her. She has 34 years of experience doing this work. She also has a store in her house. Her fields are a 5-minute walk from her house, and she works there from 7-10 am every day during the planting season.

María is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer for her maize crop. She is also preparing the land to grow sesame, and harvesting the crops which are ready. Her dream is to see her grandchildren educated and to have improved living conditions.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for her maize crop and prepare the land to grow sesame

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Female small-scale farmers dominate the agricultural landscape in most production environments in Kenya, yet they constitute the majority of rural actors locked in socio-cultural structures that limit their agricultural productivity, efficiency and effectiveness at all points across the value chain. Key examples are entrenched inequities in access to productive land, limited access to credit, poor access to markets, extension services, and agricultural technologies relevant to their needs. 

Kiva lenders, the above picture presents Nancy, who started farming four years ago on a small inherited piece of land in the Kapsabet area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of four children sells milk, eggs, tea, and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Nancy’s source of income are vegetables, milk, and egg selling; these products are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market, but one problem that she faces is delivering to the market on time. The Nandihills area has a poor road network and poor feeder roads that really hamper timely delivery of products to the market; that is why Nancy is kindly seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. 

Using the motorbike, she will deliver products to the market on time and reap more profits because the products will still be fresh. Nancy is very determined to succeed, and because she is much disciplined with finances, she plans that through accumulated profits she will be able to provide a secure future for herself and also for her parents. 

Nancy's dream is to go back to school and she hopes that through your loan, you will help her realize her dream.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Mirna Esperanza

texts.es:
Mirna de 37 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos de 17, 14, 13 y 9 años de edad,  todos están estudiando. Ella solo estudió hasta 3er grado de educación básica, su pareja se dedica a la crianza de ganado. Solo él y sus hijos viven con ella.
Mirna es comerciante, ordeñas las vacas que poseen para vender la leche y de ahí obtener lo que necesitan para pagar los gastos del hogar, tiene más de 15 años de dedicarse a esta actividad aprendió trabajando con su esposo. Esta es la única fuente de ingreso de la familia.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar concentrado para alimentar las vacas en ordeño, para asegurar una mejor producción y así verse beneficiada toda la familia con la venta de la leche. Únicamente sueña ver a sus hijos preparados profesionalmente.
texts.en:
37-year old Mirna is married and has four children aged 17, 14, 13, and 9, all of whom attend school. Mirna herself has only a grade 3 education. Her husband raises livestock for a living. Only he and the children live with her.

Mirna is a businesswoman. She milks the cows and then sells the milk. With the money she earns she pays for household necessities. She learned this work from her husband and has been doing it for fifteen years. It is the sole source of income for the family.

Mirna is seeking a loan to buy special feed for the cows and thus get improved milk production. The increased income will benefit the whole family. Her only dream is to see her children with good professional jobs.

loans.use: buy special feed for her cows

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a married man with four children, two of whom attend school. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda, where his business is taxi driving. His additional income business is a bar, where he fetches more income. Alex has been in business for six months, but complains of the work being tiresome because he has no time to rest, and limited capital. 

His dream is to buy a mini-bus to transport more people. Alex needs a loan to buy his own taxi for transportation.

loans.use: to buy his own taxi for transportation.

loans.name: Bigaaga Tukore Group

texts.en:
Wellen is the man standing with a raised hand in the photo, aged 30 and married, with five children attending school. Wellen carries out agriculture, specifically banana production; he produces seven bunches per week, which enables him to meet his financial needs, like school fees and other household needs. Wellen also carries out local brew production to supplement his income. 

Wellen applied for a loan of 500,000 to buy agricultural inputs, especially fertilizer, to increase his production. 

Wellen joined Ugafode under Bigaaga Tukore Group with other 11 members. As a group they took a loan of 6,200,000, to improve on their sources of income and be able to meet all their family financial obligations. They are happy with the financial support attained with Ugafode.

loans.use: To buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: Iris Yaneth

texts.es:
Iris de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato técnico vocacional, debido a la falta de empleo decidió dedicarse a la panadería con su esposo, actualmente son padres de 3 niños. Él trabajo de la panadería lo aprendió de su madre quien desde hace 10 años emprende dicha labor.

En la panadería Iris lleva 4 años, desde que culmino sus estudios de bachillerato, el negocio está instalado en las afueras de su pequeña casa. 

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar harina, azúcar, dulce de panela, entre otros ingredientes que se necesita para elaborar el sabor de su rico pan.

El sueño a futuro es poder comprar una pequeña casa, donde pueda vivir ella su esposo y sus hijos muy cómodamente ya que la casa adonde reside no es propia.
texts.en:
31-year old Iris graduated with a technical qualification, but because of lack of jobs in her field she decided to work in the bakery with her husband. They have three children. She learned about baking from her mother ten years ago. 

Iris has been working in the bakery for four years, ever since she finished her education. The business is located outside their small house.

The loan Iris is seeking will be used to buy flour, sugar, brown sugar and other ingredients that are needed to make delicious bread. Her dream is to buy a small house where she and her family can live more comfortably, as where they live at the moment does not belong to them.

loans.use: buy flour, sugar, brown sugar and other ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate his banana plantation.

loans.name: La'azarus

texts.en: La'azarus is a maize farmer from Kurmi Kogi district in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, La'azarus would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, he can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. La'azarus, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income from selling his maize at a later date to expand his farmland and he hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 33-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents. Her father is the one mostly supporting the family financially.  

As for her, she has been working as a private teacher since 2011. 

With the loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l., she will purchase a laptop so she can extend her knowledge and widen her expertise. Besides, Zeinab stated that this acquirement will ease her work flow, especially regarding her preparations. 

In the future, Zeinab wishes to borrow more Kiva loans with the aim of enhancing her business.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop so she can extend her knowledge and widen her expertise.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline grew up in Uasin Gishu District, which is home to a community that produces the world’s greatest marathon runners. As a child, Caroline was very focussed on school, sports, and music. Having 14 siblings and being the last born girl, she was surrounded by all the love and attention in the world. While still young, she constantly dreamed of going to schools that have a variety of academic options where she would have the opportunity to showcase the creative and innovative sides of her personality.

Although Caroline was a good student academically, she faced serious challenges stemming from being a girl in a family that is so deep-rooted in Kalenjin traditions. She seemed to handle these challenges well through primary education. Much to the delight of her parents, who were hardworking farmers, Caroline passed the national examination with flying colors and was admitted to a high school after a competitive application process.

However, things started tumbling down when her father passed away right after Caroline started high school. The absence of a will set in motion a succession battle, which brought out the ugly side of close people she thought she knew all her life. In the end, she was left with nothing. She had no one to run to because even though the courts had granted women equal rights to inheritance, the stubborn persistence of patriarchy among the family members saw that Caroline’s rights remained contested. She had to do a series of menial jobs in order to pay for her tuition. After high school, she went ahead and attained a certificate in Business Management and later a Diploma in Human Resource management.

In 2008, she landed her first ‘real’ job as an office assistant in Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance institution that serves rural smallholder farmers across Kenya. She made the best of the position by putting her own creative and innovative spin on how to bring transformation to the lives of rural farmers locked in poverty. Within a short time, she was made a Business Development Officer, where she continued to perform dazzlingly. Today, Caroline is the Branch Manager of the leading office in terms of growth and performance!

Caroline is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to complete the payment for a course in Sociology. She decided to enroll in sociology after her leadership position presented her with certain challenges in regards to the understanding of human social behavior. She is confident that sociology will make her a better leader who has a developed body of knowledge about social order, social disorder, and social change. This course will equip her with invaluable knowledge and skills to influence a culture of positive change among employees as well as farmers.

Caroline stated, “My goal is to provide the right environment, so that employees can work together and tap into their innate creativity to solve business challenges. My dream is to be a role model to my 4-year-old daughter. Everything I do is meant to shape her identity and make her experience the world as a free place where she doesn't have to limit herself to the roles that society foists on her. To do all this, I am counting on your consideration and support. Thanks.”

loans.use: to pay for higher education

loans.name: Mathew

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, he can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. When asked, Mathew spoke of his ambition to use the loan to educate his children, eventually ensuring that his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson, age 46, is married and has five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

He deals in produce, selling mainly maize, beans and groundnuts. He gets supplementary income from farming, a business he has operated for 15 years. 

His vision is build a personal house despite the seasonal changes that cause him capital insufficiency. 

Wilson has asked for a loan to buy iron sheets, timber and cement to construct his house and to satisfy his dream.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets, timber and cement to construct his house.

loans.use: to purchase storage for his crops.

loans.name: Gogoni Group

texts.en:
Mariam is a mother of four children who are at school. She is 40 years old. 

She is a widow running several businesses to support her family. She runs a store of charcoal and fishes, a business she has been with for ten years now. She works from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. per working day and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This is her second credit request from Kiva's partner Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous credit, since repaid successfully, to buy stock for her businesses (fish and charcoal). With this loan, she received extra income, which she used to cover part of her household expenses and school fees. 

In the coming years, Mariam would like to manage a big store of charcoal and take her children to a better school. 

Mariam will use this new loan to buy stocks of charcoal to resell. She will share this loan with her group member from Gogoni group.

loans.use: to buy stocks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to implement sanitary facilities, which aren't in the necessary working conditions.

loans.name: Hector

texts.en:
Hector has been in the entertainment industry for over 20 years and has headed his own company, Metro Talent Group, Inc, since 1998. He helps new talent break into movies, television, and commercials. He also works on music production and concert presentations for the preservation of Latin music (salsa, mambo, cha-cha, boleros). A recent highlight was working as the music consultant for “El Cantante,” a project about the life and times of a major Latin music star with Marc Antony and Jennifer Lopez.

Hector is coming to Accion because he plans to go on a major tour, a tribute to the great Latin musicians. Hector needs a loan for some necessary equipment for promotions, advertising, and public relations for this tour. This tour helps Hector “to continue my mission in preserving the music we call salsa, mambo, cha-cha and boleros.” 

In the future, Hector hopes to lecture and hold workshops on Latin music and the entertainment industry.

You can check out his latest CD project here: http://www.mtgallstarsny.com/

loans.use: to purchase equipment to help with advertising and promotion of events.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid, a married man with two children, is age 30 years and living in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

His business is motorcycle riding alongside farming to supplement his income. He started the business seven years back with an aim of supporting his family. 

His personal dream is educating his children and his business dream is buying more motorcycles to fetch more income. He complains of bad roads leading to increase in expenditure to repair his motorcycles and inadequate capital. 

Rashid is requesting a loan to buy another motorcycle for transportation.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for transportation.

loans.name: Yahaya Gambo

texts.en:
Yahaya Gambo is a Babban Gona maize farmer. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yahaya Gambo would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yahaya Gambo can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked about his goals, Yahaya Gambo expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, become the most  profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

texts.en: Magajiya is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. She joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children, Isiya, Adamu, and Nuhu.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Magajiya would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, she can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. When asked, Magajiya spoke of her ambition to use the loan to educate her children, eventually ensuring that her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest time.

Like other Babban Gona members, Isihaka is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan is a maize farmer from Chiroma village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, he would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Jonathan can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. Jonathan, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income from selling his maize at a later date to expand his farmland, and he hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn and wood for her business selling tortillas.

loans.name: Luís Alfredo

texts.es:
Luís de 23 años de edad, estudió hasta 3°grado de educación básica en la escuela de su comunidad, se encuentra acompañado y es padre de un hijo de 6 años.

Luís  trabaja como ayudante de albañil, también es agricultor y trabaja en una granja de pollo el cual le permite obtener los ingresos para su familia.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para construir el techo de la vivienda donde tiene planeado vivir con su hijo y esposa; el dinero lo necesita para comprar lamina, para colocarlos como paredes de la vivienda y mejorar el piso.

El sueño de Luís es construir una casa permanente que les brinde mucha seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Luís is 23 years old and studied up to 3rd year of Junior high school in his community. He is in a relationship and is the father of a 6 year old son. Luís works as an assistant bricklayer. He is also a farmer and works on a chicken farm which allows him to make an income for his family.

The loan that he is requesting is to construct the roof of his house where he plans to live with his wife and son. He needs to buy laminate to put up as walls of the house and to improve the floor. Luís's dream is to construct a permanent house that will provide his family with much security.

loans.use: to buy laminate and place it as walls of his house and improve the floor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Maria Noemi

texts.es:
María de 40 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene 2 hijos de, estudió hasta 2nd grado de educación básica. Es comerciante, anteriormente vendía en la cancha de futbol yuca frita, pasteles, jugos, gaseosas y refrescos naturales, pero por la inseguridad en la zona el equipo se desintegró y se vio en la necesidad de buscar otra actividad al ver que sus ventas no eran suficiente; hoy se dedica a la venta de ropa de casa en casa y la apoya su hijo mayor.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar pantalones y blusas que son las prendas que más vende y quiere tener ropa de reserva por la temporada que se acerca. Tiene pensado ampliar su negocio quiere ver la manera de que su hijo pueda visitar otras comunidades.
texts.en: María is 40 years old. She is in a relationship and has two children. She studied up to the second year of Junior High school. She is a businessperson. She used to sell fried yucca, pastries, juice, soft drinks and natural drinks at the football field but the team was discontinued due to the violence in the area. So she had to find another business since she didn't have enough sales. Today she sells clothing from door-to-door with the help of her oldest son. She is requesting a loan to buy pants and blouses which are the clothing that she sells most. She wants to have clothing on hand for the season that is approaching. She is thinking of expanding her business. She wants to see how her family can visit other communities.

loans.use: to buy pants and blouses.

loans.name: Alberto David

texts.es:
Alberto de 29 años de edad, estudió hasta 3° grado de educación básica en la escuela de la comunidad, tiene 3 hijos y su esposa se dedica a los trabajos domésticos, ellos viven en casa propia.

Alberto trabaja en la agricultura ,sembrando 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz por cada temporada, trabajo que aprendió de sus padres y con esto garantiza la alimentación de la familia, de igual forma Alberto trabaja como ayudante de albañil.
 
El préstamo que esta solicitando, es  para comprar láminas, madera, entre otros materiales que necesita para construir una cocina, ya que ellos cocinan con leña  y esto provoca mucho humo en la casa y necesitan construir una división para colocar la cocina aparte.

El sueño de  Alberto es tener una vivienda que reúna todas las condiciones necesarias para brindarles una buena protección a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alberto is 29 years old. He went to school through the 3rd grade of primary school in the community school. He has 3 children and his wife is a homemaker. They live in their own home. 

Alberto works in agriculture. He farms a 7,000 square meters of corn each season. He learned the work from his parents and with it he guarantees the family's food. Alberto also works as an assistant bricklayer.  
 
The loan he is asking for is to buy sheeting, wood and mother materials he needs to build  kitchen. They have been cooking with firewood, and this causes a lot of smoke to get into the house and they need to build a dividing wall to have the kitchen set apart. 

Alberto's dream is to have a house that has all of the necessary conditions to offer good protection to his children.

loans.use: to buy sheeting, wood, and other materials he needs to build a kitchen. They have been cooking with firewood, and this causes a lot of smoke to get in the house.

loans.name: Asunciona

texts.es:
Asunciona tiene 44 años de edad, es conviviente, vive con su esposo e hijos, en casa propia, en una comunidad grande, goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Y está ubicada en el distrito de Saña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Asunciona se dedica a la actividad de venta de abarrotes, pollo, carnes y verduras,desde hace mas de 10 años de antigüedad en el negocio, en su propio domicilio. Solicita préstamo para surtir y aumentar su stock de productos de su bodega, compra de mercadería como arroz, azúcar y verduras. De esta manera hacer crecer mas su negocio,obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Asunciona is 44 years old. She is in a common law marriage and lives with her husband and children in their own house in a large community. She has good personal and work references from her neighbors. Her community is basically dedicated to agriculture, ranching and commerce. It's located in the district of  Saña, province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, northern coast of Peru.

Asunciona works in the activity of selling groceries such as chicken, meats and vegetables. She has more than 10 years' seniority in the business, which is in her own house. She is asking for the loan to stock and expand the inventory of products in her store by buying merchandise such as rice, sugar and vegetables. This way, she can grow her business, obtain more income and be able to improve her quality of life. In the short term, this will allow her to improve her income, increase her profits, and thus improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to stock and grow her inventory of products in her store by buying merchandise like rice, sugar and vegetables.

loans.name: Zoila Elizabeth

texts.es:
Zoila de 21 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene 3 hijos, estudio hasta 9° grado de educación básica porque sus padres no pudieron seguir pagando sus estudios y además le daban poca importancia. Ella es comerciante, desde hace 10 años vende comida y pupusas, es su única fuente de ingresos y con la que mantiene a sus hijos, 

Solicita el préstamo para hacerle reparaciones a la galera donde tiene su negocio, prácticamente necesita cambiar todo porque está muy deteriorada, va a comprar cemento, arena laminas y pagará mano de obra. Sueña con un mejor negocio y darle lo necesario a su hijo y que no sufran lo que ella paso por la falta de dinero.
texts.en:
Zoila is 21 years old is in a relationship and has 3 children. She studied up to Grade 9 of basic education as her parents couldn't continue to pay for her education. They also didn't feel that it was important. She is a businesswoman who for the past 10 years has sold meals and pupusas. This is her only source of income and how she supports her children.

She is requesting a loan to make repairs on the kitchen where she has her business. She has to replace practically everything as it is in very bad condition. She will buy cement, sand, laminate and pay for labor. She dreams of having a better business and provide her son what he needs and not have to suffer what she went through due to the lack of money.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, laminate and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Alba de 69 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos ya mayores y con su propio hogar. Su pareja es agricultor y productor ganadero, Alba no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar y con ella solo vive su esposo y 2 nietos. Alba es comerciante, vende queso y leche producto del ganado que tienen, también se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas mayormente, pero debido a su edad delegan esas actividades a otras personas y ella solo colabora.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar fertilizante, semillas y plaguicidas para tener insumos listos para sembrar, al vivir cerca de un rio tienen la oportunidad de sembrar todo el año. Sueña con tener la fuerza para seguir trabajando y tener un puesto de venta en el municipio de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Alba, 69, is married and has four children already grown and in their own homes. Her partner is a farmer and raises lifestock. Alba didn't have the opportunity to study and only her husband and two grandchildren live with her. Alba is a shopkeeper, she sells cheese and milk products from the cattle she has. She also makes her living mainly with agricultural work, but because of her age, she delegates these activities to other people and she only contributes. 

Alba asks for a loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, and insecticides to have supplies ready to sow. Living near a river gives Alba's family the opportunity to sow throughout the year. Alba dreams of having the strength to continue this work and to have a market stall in her town.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and insecticide

loans.name: Suleman

texts.en:
Suleman is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Suleman joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Makaddas, Shitu and Saminu. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Suleman would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Suleman can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Suleman  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Erika Vanessa

texts.es:
Erika de 18 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, estudió hasta 6°grado de educación básica, vive con sus padres y 7 hermanos, nadie depende de ella. Se comerciante desde hace tres años se dedica a vender queso fresco y queso seco, aprendió con su madre, esta es su única fuente de ingreso que pudo optar al no tener opciones de trabajo, lo hace en su comunidad durante 5 horas diarias.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar leche y queso para su negocio, de esta forma se verá beneficiada cubriendo la demanda de la zona y apoyando a su familia ya que ella y su hermano son los únicos que trabajan. Piensa más adelante poner un puesto de venta formal para su negocio.
texts.en:
Erica, age 18, is single and does not have children.  She went to school through the sixth grade.  She lives with her parents and seven siblings.  No one is dependent upon her.  She is a merchant.  For three years she has been selling fresh cheese and dried cheese.  She learned with her mother.  This is her only source of income that she was able to choose because she did not have any job options.  She does this in her community for five hours a day.

She is requesting the loan to buy milk and cheese for her business.  This way she will benefit from covering the demand in the area.  She will be supporting her family because she and her brother are the only ones who work.  Later on she plans on setting up a formal sales stand for her business.

loans.use: to buy milk and cheese for her business.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is a maize farmer from Katsinawa village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Zainabu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Zainabu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Zainabu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand her farmland, and hopes to ensure other members of her community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en:
Ayuba is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Ayuba joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Ibrahim and Martina.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ayuba would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ayuba can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Ayuba  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Daniel Kargo

texts.en:
Daniel Kargo is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Daniel Kargo joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Livingston and Mercy.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Daniel Kargo would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Daniel Kargo can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Daniel Kargo spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Francis Yohany

texts.es:
Francis, de 29 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está casada y su esposo trabaja de motorista, no tienen hijos. Francis, depende de los ingresos de su esposo, el viaja en carro hasta su lugar de trabajo.-

Ella necesita el préstamo para que su esposo arregle el carro que tiene, el necesita pagarle al mecánico y comprar repuestos, el préstamo es vital para que el continúe trabajando.-

Francis, estará más tranquila sabiendo que su esposo tendrá mayor seguridad con el carro arreglado.

El sueño de Francis es, que Dios le dé la oportunidad de ser madre y poder encontrar un trabajo estable para lograr todos los objetivos que tiene con su esposo.
texts.en:
Francis, age 29, has a high school education.  She is married, and he husband works as a driver.  They do not have children.  Francis is dependent upon her husband’s income.  He travels by car to his place of work.

She needs the loan for her husband to fix the car that he has.  He needs to pay the mechanic and buy replacement parts.  The loan is vital for him to continue working.  Francis will rest easier knowing that her husband will be safer with the car fixed.

Francis’s dream is for God to give her the opportunity to be a mother and to be able to find stable work in order to achieve all of the objectives that she and her husband have.

loans.use: to pay the mechanic and to buy replacement parts to fix her husband's car.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angelica su estado civil es conviviente, con carga familiar. Reside en casa propia junto a su esposa e hijos hija, natural de la zona. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila ya que su actividad es la agricultura, ganadería, comercio y transporte. Dicha comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de Buenos Aires, provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

Angelica se dedica a la venta de aborrotes, tiene una pequeña bodega donde ofrece a la venta arroz, azúcar, cafe, etc. Además se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado caprino, esta actividad la realiza desde hace más de 10 años, además Angelica cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos quienes trabajan en Lima, ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias en la zona, y crediticias. El destino del crédito sera para construcción de 2 habitaciones en su vivienda, pues desea ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida brindandole mayor comodidad y seguridad a su familia en su casa.
texts.en:
Angelica is in a common law marriage and has a family. She lives in her own house with her husband and children. She is from the area. Life in the community is peaceful because its main activities are agriculture, ranching, commerce and transportation. The community is located in the district of Buenos Aires, province of Morropón, region of Piura, northern coast of Peru.

Angelica works selling groceries. She has a small store where she sells rice, sugar, coffee, etc. In addition, she raises and sells goats. She has been doing this for more than 10 years. She also has the help of her children, who work in Lima. She has very good references in the are and a good credit history.
