Ni Wayan and all members of the Glory Dewata Group make their payment to MUK and they agree to continue their loan with the same loan size. They expect MUK will continue to support them in terms of capital and training.

loans.use: to purchase superior feed and corn seeds for her garden

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain 2 hectares of coffee crop, assuring a greater and better production for the 2015 harvest.

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es:
Marcos, de años de 22 años de edad, es un joven trabajador y emprendedor con deseos de superarse cada día mucho mas, para asegurar el bienestar de su esposa y el de su hijo que está por nacer.- Su familia fue quien le enseño a trabajar desde que era un niño. Su esposa actualmente se dedica  a los oficios del hogar.

Marcos, no estudió pues sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos y lo llevaban a sembrar los  granos básicos y en las hortalizas para el consumo.

A los doce años Marcos, emigro a la ciudad para trabajar descargando carros de verduras en el mercado central de la ciudad, lo hacia en compañía de un amigo que le motivo a realizar esa labor.- Se levantaba a la 1 de la madrugada y fue así como inicio en sus primeros trabajos.

Con el paso del tiempo el inicio vendiendo verduras en la ciudad, ahora el viaja de lunes a sábados desde las cinco de la mañana para la ciudad a vender sus productos y regresa a su casa por la tarde. 

Marcos, solicita un crédito en la institución para la compra de una cama para que duerma su bebe que esta por nacer.- Además, comprará otros artículos que el bebe necesita y adecuar algunos lugares en el hogar, también invertirá $300.00 en para cosechar el maíz y el frijol que han sembrado sus padres.

El sueño de Marcos es, ahorrar para comprar un local propio en donde pueda ofrecer mejor sus productos y de está manera darles mejores condiciones para vivir a su esposa y a su bebe.

También desea comprar un propiedad para poder construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Marcos is 22 years old. He is an enterprising and hard-working young man with the desire to be better every day in order to ensure the well-being of his wife and newborn son. His family was who taught him to work since he was a boy. His wife today takes care of the home. Marcos didn't go to school as his family had few economic resources, and they took him to plant basic grains and food crops. At 12 years old Marco moved to the city to work on the vegetable stands in the central city market. He did this work with a friend. He used to get up a 1:00 AM to work and this is how he started his first job. With the passage of time he began selling vegetables in the city. Now he travels Monday through Saturday from 5:00 AM to the city to sell his products and he returns home in the afternoon.

Marcos seeks a loan to buy a bed where his newborn baby can sleep.. In addition, he will buy other items his baby needs and make some accommodations in his home. He will also invest $300 in harvesting corn and beans that his parents planted. Marcos dreams of saving enough money to buy his own locale where he can better offer his products and in this way provide better living conditions to his wife and baby. He also wishes to buy property upon which he can build a home.

loans.use: to buy a bed where his newborn baby can sleep.

loans.name: Zulmira

texts.en: Zulmira lives in Oecusse, and her business is restaurant food. She lives near many people, so she had an idea to open a restaurant for everybody to come eat in her restaurant. She earns a good income every day because many people come to eat in her restaurant, so she is very happy with her business. And now she is applying for a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business because she wants to open a bigger restaurant in the future. She started the restaurant in 2006 with her own working capital of $100. She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more materials, such as rice, beef, pork, fish, chicken, herbs, eggs, and instant noodles, for the restaurant. She hopes that, with this loan, her business can improve in the future.

loans.use: To buy rice, beef, pork, fish, chicken, herbs, eggs, instant noodles and other materials for the restaurant.

loans.name: Ma. Nimfa

texts.en:
Ma. Nimfa is a married woman and a mother of six children from Ormoc City, Leyte. Ma. Nimfa is engaged in retail sales of ready to wear clothes and other accessories. This has been the source of her income for the past seven years now.

Ma. Nimfa is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell such as clothes, slippers and sandals, cosmetics and fashion accessories. This loan will help her to improve her stock thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. 

In the future, Ma. Nimfa hopes to expand her business so that it will generate more revenue. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as clothes, slippers and sandals, cosmetics and fashion accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies to make her products and to fulfill orders.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in her grocery store, she wants to expand and diversify the stock of products.

loans.name: Anielka De La Concepcion

texts.es:
El bienestar de las personas y la prosperidad de estas, siempre ha sido el interés principal de Anielka, una joven inteligente y carismática que estudia cuarto año de la carrera de Trabajo Social en modo Sabatino. Tiene 29 años, está casada y tiene tres hijos de las edades de 14, 8 y 2 años. Junto a su esposo luchan día a día, para que sus menores tengan salud y educación de calidad y de esta manera logren un futuro prospero. Al mismo tiempo, agradece infinitamente el apoyo de su madre.
En la actualidad contar con los equipos tecnológicos necesarios son de gran utilidad tanto en el ámbito de estudiante como trabajador, razón principal por la que Anielka solicita un crédito, puesto que requiere de una computadora. Ella deposita su confianza en el financiamiento puesto que ayudará a realizar investigaciones desde casa y entregar los trabajos en tiempo y forma. Su meta es seguir profesionalizándose, anhela estudiar un pos grado y lograr obtener ofertas de trabajo en su área.
texts.en:
People's well-being and prosperity have always been Anielka's main interest. She is an intelligent and charismatic young woman who is in her fourth year of studies for a degree in the Sabatino model of Social Work. She is 29 years old, is married and has three children ages 14, 8 and 2. Together with her husband, she strives day after day to ensure that her children are healthy and getting a quality education so they can have a prosperous future. She is also infinitely grateful for her mother's support.

Having the necessary technical equipment is now very useful for studying and working. This is the main reason why Anielka is asking for a loan, since she needs a computer. She is putting her faith in the financing because it will allow her to do research from home and to deliver her work in due time. Her goal is to keep expanding her professional experience; she longs to study for a graduate degree and to get job offers in her area.

loans.use: to pay for a computer

loans.name: 030701030001. Thiệu Long Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mộc works in agriculture raising poultry. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more feed to raise poultry to sell in the future.

Mộc is 64 years old and married with one child. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

She is the leader of an eight-member group, the 030701030001 Thiệu Long Solidarity Group.

In 2010, Mộc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

loans.use: to purchase more feed to raise poultry to sell in the future.

loans.name: Mercedes Candelaria

texts.es:
Mercedes de 55 años de edad, está casada y  tiene 5 hijos, todos ya acompañados y solo vive con ella su hija menor quien tiene un hijo de dos meses. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura, con su esposo cultivando frijol blanco y de seda en ocasiones también maíz; También tienen una plantación de limones. Para vender su producto tiene que desplazarse  en autobús y se tarda 40 minutos para llegar al mercado local.

Solicita el préstamo para mejorar sus ventas, comprar 8 javas para transportar los limones al mercado, comprar una novilla debido a que poseen un terreno donde cultiva el maíz y cuando saque la cosecha lo usara como pasto o potrero para la novilla. Mercedes sueña con vender además granos básicos y también en un futuro dedicarse a la venta de lácteos.
texts.en:
Mercedes, age 55, is married and has 5 children. All of them have a life partner, except for her youngest daughter who lives with her and has a two months old son. 

She has worked her whole life in agriculture along with her husband. They cultivate white and red beans, and sometimes corn too. They also have a lemons plantation.

To sell their product they have to use a bus and it takes 40 minutes to get to the local market. She is requesting this loan to improve her sales by purchasing 8 containers to carry the lemons to the market. 

She will also buy a heifer, since she has a piece of land where she cultivates corn and when the harvest end she can use it as a pastureland for the heifer.

Mercedes’ dream is to sell more staple grains and in a future sell dairy.

loans.use: to buy 8 containers to carry the lemons to the market, and a heifer.

loans.name: 031905040002. Thị Trấn Quán Lào Group

texts.en:
Phượng is applying for a loan to purchase machines to do tailor-made clothing and a clothing repair service. She has a service business tailoring clothes. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years.

Phượng is 42 years old and married with two children. She lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Phượng is the group leader of the 31905040002 Solidarity Group, which consists of four members.

This is Phượng’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Phượng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

loans.use: to purchase machines to do tailor-made clothing and a clothing repair service.

loans.name: Dongnai Group

texts.en:
Chuesong's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams; however, the water from natural sources in Chuesong's village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water. 

Chuesong is excited that she, like her group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. 

Even though some people in the village, including Chuesong, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income to users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. Chuesong and other filter users also decrease the amount of money spent to boil water by purchasing less charcoal or wood and decreasing the time spent foraging for firewood. 

Chuesong's filter is guaranteed for two years, though most users find the filter works from 3-5 years. The wives of many of the buyers are pictured.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Ma. Erlinda

texts.en:
Ma. Erlinda is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Leyte, Philippines. She runs a small sari-sari (variety) or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place.

Ma. Erlinda is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, vegetables, rice, soap and toiletries, condiments and others. With a loan, she will be able to improve her stock thus attracting more buyers to her store. 

In the future, Ma. Erlinda hopes of making her business more profitable and stable. She also wants to save money for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, vegetables, rice, soap and toiletries, condiments and others

loans.name: Nhóm 12 - Tây Sơn 1 - Phú Sơn3 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huyền has a service business of skin care. She is requesting a loan to purchase more supplies to maintain her beauty salon. Huyền has been involved in this business for two years.

Huyền is 21 years old and married with one child. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

Huyền is the group leader of the Nhóm 12 - Tây Sơn 1 - Phú Sơn3 Solidarity Group, which consists of three members.

This is Huyền’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Huyền faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Huyền hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies to maintain her beauty salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, tables, and chairs to increase her production and to be able to serve her customers with greater comfort.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing for children and adults, as well as shoes, bags and body creams, among other products.

loans.name: Sumber Mulia Group

texts.en:
Sumber Mulia Group got a loan for the seventh time. The number of members is eight, and the total loan is 14,400,000 IDR.

Having been successful with maintaining fattening pigs, Ketut is using this period of the loan to purchase four types of local pigs for pork barbeque, and which will be maintained for two months.

The remainder of the loan will be used to fix the cage for the preparation of a new birth from the sow that she already owns. The price of pig feed is currently very expensive, but Ketut remains optimistic about her business going forward.

With all the benefits she gets, she plans to repair her home and also save for the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase four types of local pigs and fix the cage.

loans.name: Vecinas Alegres Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Vecinas Alegres está en su ciclo número 8 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan para salir adelante, son mujeres muy luchadoras que quieren ayudar a sus familias por medio de su esfuerzo.
La Sra. Amelia es una de las integrantes,  es costurera,  y comenta que se ha abierto camino para poder ayudar a su familia para poder darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener.  Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas y gomas para poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group named Vecinas Alegres [Happy Neighbors] is in their 8th round of the Women's Committee program, where all of them work and help each other to get ahead. They are very determined women that want to help their families through their efforts.

Amelia is one of the members. She is a seamstress, and mentions that a pathway has been opened for her to be able to help her family and give them all the things that she couldn't have. She is requesting a loan to buy fabrics and elastic to be able to continue with her work as she has always done.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, elastic, and threads to sew with.

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold is a forty-two year old married man with four kids. The oldest child is 9 and the youngest is 2. He hails from Mcarthur, Leyte.

Arnold engages in fishing. He catches and sells fish. It has already been already 10 years since he started this kind of business. He also runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling basic commodities like sugar, noodles, eggs, canned goods and soft drinks.

Arnold is asking for a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy additional stocks for the store and fishing materials like fish nets and feed for fish. This is very helpful in augmenting Arnold's sources of livelihood. In this way he could filled his store with various stocks and increase the yield of his fishing business.

Arnold dreams of expanding both his businesses to be productive allowing him to support the needs of his growing children.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for the store and fishing materials like fish nets and feed for fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Blanca Mery

texts.es:
Blanca es una carismática, emprendedora, trabajadora y soñadora mujer de 55 años de edad que con la ayuda de un amigo quien le enseño como vender inicio su negocio de venta de mercancía, más enfocado en artículos de salón de belleza y productos para el cuidado de la piel.
Gracias a sus buenos resultados ha podido invertir en su negocio poco a poco, tiene una vitrina y variedad de productos.
Su empresa inicio en el año 2004 y desde ese entonces se ha convertido en el medio de sustento para su familia conformada por su esposo y dos hijos. 
Buscando mejorar sus ventas, atraer mayor mercado, ser competitiva  y un mejor bienestar para su familia solicita un crédito, para la compra de productos para el cuidado capilar y de la piel, y algunos artículos básicos de salón de belleza como peines, cepillos.
Blanca espera tu ayuda, tu puedes ser partícipe del proyecto de esta mujer que busca capital para brindarle estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Blanca is a charismatic, enterprising, hardworking, 55-year-old woman with big dreams. With the help of a friend who showed her how to sell, she started her business selling merchandise, mostly focused on beauty salon items and skin care products. Thanks to her good profits she has been able to invest in her business bit by bit; she has a showcase and a variety of products. She started her business in 2004 and since then she has turned it into a means for supporting her family, consisting of her husband and two children.
 
She is asking for a loan to improve her sales, attract a greater market share, be competitive and provide greater well-being for her family. She will use the loan to buy capillary and skin care products and some basic beauty salon items like combs and brushes. Blanca is hoping for your help; you can participate in this woman's plans to seek capital to provide her children with an education.

loans.use: to buy capillary and skin care products and basic beauty salon items

loans.name: Rone

texts.en:
This is Rone, 38, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. He is married to Bernadette and they have children. He together with his wife he manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses.

Rone is a water distributor. He retails mineral water to his customers. He sells per container (5 gallons per container) with a profit, and delivers them for free. His regular customers for his mineral water business are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to upgrade his facilities and buy more stocks of mineral water to expand capacity. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.

Rone dreams of growing his business in the coming years. He also wants his children to be able to complete their studies. He meets up with his co-fellowship members* to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more water containers or gallons of water for his business.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta, 50 years old, is married to a domestic worker and blessed with two children. She has managed a retail store in their village for almost eight years and earns a net income of PHP 200 daily.

Due to insufficient funds for her business, she would like to access a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase grocery items, frozen foods, raw meat, fish, and chicken to sell.

She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, frozen foods, raw meat, fish, and chicken to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at her home to improve access to water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Leidy Johana

texts.es:
Leidy una mujer de 30 años de edad, madre de 5 hijos, básicamente es una madre cabeza de familia dado que se encuentra separada de su esposo y ha podido levantar a sus hijos con la ayuda de su negocio de venta de repuestos y reparación de bicicleta.
Leidy es muy preocupada le ha dado difícil ejercer como empresaria y madre al mismo tiempo sus hijos son pequeños no superan los 15 años de edad y busca la manera de que estos puedan acceder a una educación primaria y secundaria.
Aprendió del negocio gracias a que anteriormente era empleada en una empresa que ofertaba servicios similares. Leidy busca a través de la inversión sacar su negocio adelante y pensando en que la bicicleta es de lo que más piden los niños para traído de navidad, quiere solicitar un crédito para comprar bicicletas  y repuestos.
Tu puedes ayudar a esta mujer a mejorar su negocio, a mantener sus 5 hijos y poder que estos estudien apóyala!.
texts.en:
Leidy is a 30-year-old woman and the mother of five children. She is basically a single mother and the head of her household, since she is separated from her husband. She has been able to support her children with the help of her bicycle parts and repair business.

Leidy is very worried, as functioning as a business owner and a mother at the same time has been difficult for her. Her children are little—none are above 15 years old—and she is trying to enable them to have access to a primary and secondary education. 

She learned the business thanks to having previously been an employee in a business that offered similar services. Through this investment, Leidy is trying to get ahead in her business. Thinking that bicycles are what children most request for Christmas, she wants to request a loan to buy bicycles and spare parts. 

You can help this woman improve her business, provide for her five children, and be able to educate them. Help her out!

loans.use: to buy bicycles and bicycle parts

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is a dried fish vendor from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is 54 years old, married, and has three children. Nilda has been engaged in selling dried fish for more than three years now. This is the source of her income.

Nilda is asking for a loan to buy more fish to dry and sell. This loan will enable her to improve her stock, thus allowing her to sell more dried fish to her customers.

In the future, Nilda hopes to expand her business in order to generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy more fish to dry and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Matilde es una mujer soltera cabeza de familia, que cansada de la pobreza de vivir casi con lo suficiente busco alternativas y aprovecho las habilidades que tenía para la cocina las cuales le enseño su madre.
Está habilidosa mujer con poco monto un negocio de venta de comidas ambulante frente a su casa, pues no puede olvidar sus labores de ama casa ya que tiene un hijo adolecente  de 16 años próximo a terminar la secundaria y con ganas de iniciar su vida universitaria.
Vende toda clase de fritos, pasteles, empanas, buñuelos, tortas de carne, arepa con carne y los acompaña con unos refrescos que igual vende. 
Solicita un crédito para la compra surtido de papas en bolsa, dulces, refrescos, fritos, panes etc.
Con la ayuda de este crédito Matilde podrá aumentar su inventario ofertar productos nuevos, que le generaran mayores ventas, ventas, atraerá más clientes y si todo le sale bien, juntara dinero para la matrícula de su hijo.
texts.en:
Matilde is a single woman who is the head of her family. Tired of the poverty of living with almost enough, she sought alternatives and took advantage of the abilities she had in the kitchen, taught to her by her mother. With very little, this talented woman started a business selling food in an itinerant fashion in front of her house, as she cannot neglect her work as a housewife since she has a 16-year-old adolescent son about to finish high school who wants to begin his university life. She sells all kinds of fried snacks, pastries, empanadas, fritters, meat pies and meat arepas, and she accompanies them with a few fruit drinks she also sells.
 
She is asking for a loan to buy an assortment of potatoes in bags, sweets, fruit drinks, fried snacks, breads, etc. With the help of this loan, Matilde will be able increase her inventory to offer new products that will generate greater sales for her, attract more customers and, if all goes well for her, will allow her to put money together for her son's university enrollment.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of potatoes in bags, sweets, fruit drinks, fried snacks and breads

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has enriched her business. She was able to buy products and supplies that are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will let her borrow again, this time an amount of 10,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional clothing products and tailoring supplies she needs to expand her business. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance. She will also use the loan to purchase grocery items because she plans to operate her own variety store.

Zenaida wants to have business expansion so that she will be able to help sustain the needs of her family. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more clothing products and tailoring supplies she needs in her business and to buy grocery items to resell.

loans.name: Sandra Marlene

texts.es: Sandra es una mujer de 33 años de edad que se esfuerza cada día para poder sostener la economía de su hogar, apoyada en su negocio de venta de productos de belleza y ropa para dama. Ella habita al lado de su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos en vivienda propia desde hace algunos años. Sandra sabe que su mayor soporte económico es su negocio, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: productos de belleza y ropa para dama y así obtener más y mejores ingresos que le brinden una mayor estabilidad económica en su hogar.
texts.en:
Sandra is a 33 year old woman who strives every day to meet the household expenses backed by her business of selling beauty products and clothing for women. 

She and her life companion and her two children have been living in their own home for some years. 

Sandra knows that her greatest financial support is her business which is why she is asking for a loan through FUSAI to invest in: beauty products and clothing for women and thus to obtain more and better earnings to provide greater financial stability at home.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of beauy products and clothing for women.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at her home to improve access to water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Thaddeus Jose

texts.es:
Thaddeus es un joven de 21 años de edad, que durante su infancia se mostró muy interesado por las labores que ejercía su madre, ella era un confeccionista y le enseño a Thaddeus como confeccionar, dándole trabajo a ratos para que este pudiera ganar algo de dinero y comprara sus cosas.
Thaddeus muy motivado por el dinero que estaba ganando decidió montar su propio negocio de confección y buscar sus propios clientes, y desde el año 2011 comenzó ofertando sus servicios a terceros. 
Ahora quiere mejorar sus ventas, mirar hacia el futuro y quiere tener su propia línea de ropa por ello solicita un crédito para la compra de telas, hilos y accesorios para confeccionar blusas para dama y camisetas para hombre.
Ayuda a este joven que a través de su negocio ayuda a su madre y paga su estudio, no le gusta esperar que sus padres le paguen todo prefiera trabajar y ganarse lo suyo.
texts.en:
Thaddeus is a 21-year-old young man who showed a lot of interest in the work his mother did when he was a child. She was a seamstress and showed Thaddeus how to make clothing, giving him work here and there so he could earn some money and buy things he wanted. Very motivated by the money he was earning, Thaddeus decided to start his own clothing business and find his own customers. He has been offering his services to third parties since 2011. 

Looking to the future, he wants to improve his sales and to have his own line of clothing. For this reason is asking for a loan to buy fabric, thread and accessories to make blouses for women and shirts for men. You can help this young man, who, through his business, is helping his mother and paying for his studies. He doesn't like to expect his parents to pay for everything for him; he prefers to work and earn his own money.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread to make his own clothing

loans.name: Yessica Marcela

texts.es:
Yesica es una joven de 18 años de edad, que al ver que su familia no podida pagarle una educación universitaria de inmediato busco la manera para ella misma generarse los ingresos necesarios para estudiar.
Es una mujer soltera que vende mercancía, productos de consumo y de cuidado para el cuerpo, buscando también que las personas adopten hábitos saludables en su alimentación diaria. 
Gracias a un vecino aprendió esta actividad, él la inscribió y le mostro la ventaja de vender estos productos y desde entonces ha ido adquiriendo experiencia y clientes.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de más productos de consumo personal, pues no solo quiere vender en su local si no que piensa ir puerta a puerta a hablar de la ventaja que traen estos productos y buscando mejorar sus ventas ya que los gastos universitarios son grandes y ella se siente muy motivada al ser capaz de pagar sus estudios con su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Yessica is 18 years old and upon seeing that her family could not afford to pay for a college education she immediately looked for a way she herself could earn the money she needed in order to study.

She is a single women who sells merchandise, consumer and body care products, looking also for people adopting healthy habits into their daily diet.

Thanks to a neighbor she learned this activity. He signed her up and showed her the advantage of selling these products and since then she has gotten experience and customers.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy more personal consumer products, as not only does she want to sell in her neighborhood but she is thinking of going from door to door telling people of the advantage that these products bring and looking to improve her sales as her school expenses are large and she feels very motivated to be able to pay for her studies with her own business.

loans.use: to buy personal products to sell that focus on caring for the body

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet in their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is a busy mother. She is a 56-year-old married woman living in the town of Mcarthur, Leyte. She and her husband have a ten-year-old child. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic household merchandise like cooking oil, coffee, sugar, noodles, canned goods, biscuits and soap. Her husband earns a living by means of fishing.

Due to difficulty in securing capital to restart her business, Emerita is asking for a loan of 15,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) to buy various supplies for the store like beverages, canned goods and toiletries. These stocks will lead her way back to operate her store again. This could ignite customers to shop and purchase. 

In the long run, Emerita hopes that this could help improve her livelihood, and she will do her best to be successful in managing her source of living. She hopes that she would continue to finance the schooling of her child in the future to come.

loans.use: to buy various supplies for the store like beverages, canned goods and toiletries

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
Edita owns the land on which she toils. She grows and sells rice. She is a 56-year-old woman residing in Mcarthur, Leyte. Aside from that, she also raises and sells hogs as supplemental income to the family. 
 
Edita is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy additional pigs and to have capital to start a fishing business. This will be of great help to Edita and her family to have these tools. She will be able to raise and sell more hogs and eventually start her fishing business.

Edita hopes that she can handle her business in a better and sustainable way for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and to have capital to start a fishing business

loans.name: Eram

texts.en:
Eram is 41 years old and married. She lives with her husband and her children. She has four daughters. She has a vegetable business. Usually, she and her husband sell vegetables at the traditional market and have done so for over 20 years. She was glad to help increase the family income.

She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 6,000,000 rupiah. This loan will be used to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at her home to improve access to water and sanitation for her family. She wants to have access to safe sanitation for her family. Her family income is still not enough to build toilet and water resources with cash, but they are able to repay loans received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at her home to improve access to water and sanitation for her family

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
María Antonia tiene 67 años, es soltera, conocida en el medio, por su labor de crianza y venta de animales menores(patos, conejos, etc). Vive en casa propia sola, sin carga familiar, hijos viven por la misma zona con sus respectivas familias. Persona con buenas referencias personales y laborales. De familia unida. Vive en una comunidad ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú, habitada por gente amigable y amable, que se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

María Antonia se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores como patos, cuyes, cerdos, carneros.,etc., desde hace más de 20 años, de manera continua. Además se dedica a la crianza de ganado lechero. Necesita préstamo para invertir en compra de animales como cerdos y alimento de engorde balanceado para estos. Para poder satisfacer toda la demanda insatisfecha dela zona además dicha demanda crecerá por la campaña navideña, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
María Antonia is 67 years old. She is single and known in the area for her work raising and selling young animals (ducks, rabbits, etc.). She lives alone in a house that she owns, with no dependents. Her children live in the same area with their respective families. She is a person with good personal and work-related references and a supportive family. She lives in a community located in the Cayaltí district, in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region of Peru's northern coast. It is inhabited by friendly and courteous people who work in farming and livestock production.

María Antonia has earned her living by continuously buying and selling young animals like ducks, guinea pigs, pigs, sheep, etc., for more than 20 years. In addition, she raises dairy cattle. 

She needs the loan to invest in the purchase of animals, like pigs, and compound feed for them in order  to satisfy the unmet demand in the area, which will grow even more due to the Christmas season. This will allow her to improve her income in the short term, increase her profits, and thereby improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of animals, like pigs, and compound feed for them

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dressmaking supplies, such as fabric, needles, snaps, and a variety of cloth remnants

loans.name: Luis David

texts.es:
David es un joven de 25 años, responsable, honesto y con mucho amor por el trabajo, vive con su pareja y atiende un negocio de venta de frutas y verduras, actividad que inicio por necesidad económica y enseñada por su padre. 
David no solo mira el ahora, ve el futuro quiere en 5 años poder abrir un nuevo local, generar empleo, ampliar su oferta a los clientes y trabajar con precios bajos cómodos para la comunidad. 
Todos estos son incentivos que hacen a David querer mejorar y superarse cada día, ahora quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de surtido en frutas y verduras y realizar algunas adecuaciones a su local, como pintura, compra de canasta.
David espera tu ayuda, ayúdalo es busca comprar vivienda, para vivir con su pareja tranquilamente y  traer hijos al mundo.
texts.en:
David is a responsible, honest, 25-year-old young man with a lot of love for his work. He lives with his partner and has a business selling fruit and vegetables that he started due to financial need and taught by his father. David isn't just looking at the present time; in the future he wants to be able to open a new store in five years, generate employment, expand what he offers to his customers and work with low prices that are comfortable for the community.

These are all incentives that make David want to improve and overcome obstacles each day. At the moment he wants to ask for a loan to buy an assortment of fruits and vegetables and to update a few things in his store like painting and buying baskets. David hopes to have your help; he is seeking to buy a home to live calmly with his partner and bring children into the world.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Lure

texts.en: Lure is a 30-year-old man from Carles, Iloilo. He is single and owns a sari-sari (variety) store business for a living. He started this business six years ago. He sell items such as sugar, salt, cooking oil, soy sauce, detergent, shampoo, chips and noodles. He is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy soft drinks, liquors, rice and fishing materials. Lure is convinced that the more merchandise he can offer to his customers, the more they will keep on coming back to him, thus increasing his income. In the future, he hope to be more successful in his business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, liquors, rice and fishing materials

loans.name: Percilita

texts.en:
Percilita is from the municipality of Carles, Iloilo.  She is 46 years old and married with eight children. She has three dependents who are 8, 12 and 17 years old.  Percilita operates a sari-sari (variety) store business and raises hogs while her husband work as a fisherman. Percilita is asking for a loan to buy piglets, feed, eggs, canned goods, soy sauce, milk, coffee and sugar.

Percilita would like to expand her business for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed, eggs, canned goods, soy sauce, milk, coffee and sugar

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie from Cauayan City, Isabela is married and blessed with three children. Her husband is a farmer, while she manages their sari sari store. With their little earnings, it is difficult for them to send their son Rolando to college. That's why Margie wants to avail herself of a PHP 200,000 education loan to pay for Rolando’s tuition fee. Rolando is taking up a BS in Secondary Education. He wants to earn a professional degree and educate students in the near future.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fee

loans.name: Carlos Ivan

texts.es:
Carlos Ivan tiene 24 años de edad, vive en el caserio de playa azul en la casa de sus padres. él cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Y està ubicada en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Carlos Ivan està dedicado a brindar el servicio de transporte urbano a través de un automovil, los recorridos de Playa Azul – Colasay, desde hace 5 años. El destino del crédito es para reparación de su auto pues desea cambiarle algunos repuestos y llantas, para poder así asegurar el correcto funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo. Esto le permitira brindar un mejor servicio con mayor seguridad y comodidad. y esto a su vez le permitirá captar nuevos clientes, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos Ivan is 24 years old, he lives in the small village of Playa Azul in his parents' house. He has good personal and work recommendations. His community is basically dedicated to agriculture, cattle raising and commerce. It is situated in the district of Pucará, Jaén province, Cajamarca region in the sierra norte of Perú.

He offers an urban transport service with a car, and has been on routes from Playa Azul - Colasay for 5 years. The credit is to be used for the repair of his car, as he wishes to change some parts and tyres, to ensure the correct working of his tool of work. This will allow him to offer a better service with greater safety and comfort, and in turn this will enable him to gain new customers. In a short time this will allow him to improve his income, increase his profits and ultimately improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to repair his car as he wishes to change various parts and tyres.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Her name is Olivia; she is 56 years old, and a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ruben, a tricycle driver, and has two children. She and her husband work hard to meet their everyday needs. 

Olivia operates a tricycle, which her husband drives, that carries up to four passengers. In the Philippines, especially in the provinces like Silang, a tricycle is a common means of transportation. Jeepneys and buses are limited. Very few people own a vehicle.The townspeople usually ride a tricycle from their homes to market, church, to their friend’s homes and to other destinations within their community. They even transport from one town to the other. She earns a minimum of PHP 700 a day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan, which she will use for maintenance of her tricycle. It is important that her tricycle is always in  good running condition, to ensure efficient service. She is positive that her transport business will continue as their population increases. Tricycle transportation is really a need in their place. She wishes everyone a Blessed Christmas!

Olivia plans to buy another tricycle to improve her income and give her family a more prosperous life.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Jaime Alberto

texts.es:
Jaime tiene una gran responsabilidad, mantener un negocio que ha pasado de generación en generación el cual es la venta de madera, una actividad enseñada pro su padre que no solo le  dios los conocimientos para administrar el negocio le inculco los valores para poder operarlo como lo son la responsabilidad, la cordialidad, la rectitud sobre todas las cosas. 
Jaime trabaja 6 días por semana 12 horas por cada día, quiere solicitar un crédito para comprar surtido de madera de todos los tipos y tener siempre existencia para cubrir los pedidos que le hacen diariamente.
Su sueño es poder pasar su negocio a su descendencia.
texts.en:
Jaime has a great responsibility: to maintain a business selling wood that has passed from generation to generation. He learned this business from his father, who not only gave him the knowledge to manage the business but taught him the values needed to run it, like responsibility, cordiality and integrity above all things. 

Jaime works six days a week for twelve hours a day. He wants to ask for a loan to buy an assortment of wood of all types and to have a permanent stock to cover the requests he gets daily. His dream is to be able to pass his business to his descendants.

loans.use: to buy a variety of wood to have pieces available to attend to any request

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is a hardworking woman of 46. She is married with three dependents who are 12, 14 and 18 years old. Amalia and her husband are engaged in fishing and at the same time, she sells clothes (locally known as RTW). Ready-to-wear (RTW) are cheaper clothes compare to branded ones.

She is requesting a loan of 15,000 from CEVI to buy fishing nets, fuel and RTW. Amalia hopes to continue improving her inventory so she can attract more customers. Her income will be used to buy a healthy diet for the family and tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, fuel and RTW clothing

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is grateful that she was granted a 15,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy materials and equipment needed in the landscaping business. She is thankful that her business grew by word of mouth. She was referred by her clients since they are happy with her work. Through her earnings, she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 

She would now like to apply for a 30,000 loan, which she will use to buy new equipment for her landscaping, such as rakes, shovels, edgers and other items needed. It will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial assistance that will be given to her. She wishes everyone a Blessed Christmas!

Evelyn dreams to be more successful in her landscaping business. She aims to improve their quality of life and send her children to school until College. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for materials and equipment, such as rakes, shovels, brooms, edgers and other items needed in landscaping.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a 28-year-old married woman, and a mother of two young children, from Iloilo, Philippines. She is engaged in selling wood or lumber to the market. Her husband is a chainsaw operator. Jennifer is standing next to a chainsaw machine. This is the source of their income for the past ten years now. 

Jennifer is asking for a loan to buy a new chainsaw machine. With this, her husband will be able to produce more lumber, which they can sell to the market for a good price.

In the future, Jennifer hopes of making their business a success and stable. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy a new chainsaw machine

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is 58 years old, and a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Enrico and a mother to their children. She and her husband manage their household while operating a business. At this time, Rosana is working hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

Rosana operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers tailoring for curtains, bed sheets, blankets and other home trappings. Her services are also available all year round for seasonal clothing demands like uniforms. Rosana also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue her business operations, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional quantities of raw materials needed in her business, like fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other items.

Rosana dreams to have more customers and hopes to become successful in life. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week, where she can share stories of her life and business and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: Woro

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Woro. Woro is a housewife who owns and manages a small stall which sells snacks, drinks, mobile phone airtime credits, and serves utility bill payments for her customers. Woro is happily married, and she and her husband have been blessed with a 14-year-old daughter and a 10-year-old son. This happy family lives in Bekasi, a satellite city located at the east of Jakarta. 

Woro’s husband works as a staff in a local private company. Woro helps her husband support the family’s income by running the small stall.  About one and a half years ago, Woro decided to join Ruma. She was excited to join as a Ruma agent, because she wanted to learn to manage and improve her small stall. 

As the business runs, Woro is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits and utility bill payments transactions, especially on the weekends. In the photo, Woro is the one who is wearing the pink veil inside the small stall. She is posing with a Ruma field staff who is wearing a Ruma uniform. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile services in her community

loans.name: Tunas Jaya Group

texts.en:
After the first loan, Ni Komang can repay the group's loan on time. During the six months of maintaining the pigs, Ni Komang enjoyed satisfactory results.

From the sales, Ni Komang used the net gain of overall sales of her pigs for her children's education and for her family. The group hopes to continue their loan in the second period. They said thank you to the lenders, Kiva and MUK for supporting their businesses.

Now Ni Komang has a new activity. Besides farming in her garden, she also busied herself raising pigs. In this way, Ni Komang has a higher income than the time before when she was raising pigs. The breeding process is going well without any obstacles. The advantage of raising pigs is that she can use them for everyday family needs.

Having succeeded in the previous period, the Tunas Jaya group proceeded to their next loan. Based on the assessment of MUK, the group received 16,500,000 IDR again. Because most have been able to increase their number of pigs, the current loan is to buy food and fix the cages. Ni Komang used the loan to buy piglets and fertilizer for her garden. Now it is the rainy season and the right time to plant many crops in the garden. She was very pleased with the effort she can develop. She hopes both of her businesses, pigs and farming, will be successful and will use all the profits to improve the welfare of her family and make her dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy piglets and fertilizer for her garden

loans.name: Luis Gonzaga

texts.es:
Luis un hombre de 31 años de edad, responsable, honesto, afectivo, padre de un hijo de 3 años de edad.  Luis se desempeña como maestro de obra, es un hombre bajos recursos que no tiene con que invertir en su profesión dado que los altos costos de los insumos de construcción no se lo permite.
Con la ayuda de un crédito quiere invertir en herramienta de mano para acabados, maquinaria de mano, pues de momento no tiene.
Luis aprendió su profesión trabajando como ayudante de un maestro de obra quien le enseño todo del negocio y ahora si apoyan su crédito podrá ser competitivo pues le da rabia que no pueda aceptar trabajos solo por no tener la herramienta necesaria y lo que le preocupa es que tiene un bebe que necesita alimentar, ayúdalo Luis te necesita.
texts.en:
Luis is a 31 year old man who is responsible, honest, and a caring father of a three year old son. Luis works as a foreman. He is a man with few resources that can not invest in his trade. The high costs of construction supplies does not permit it. With the help of a loan he can invest in manual tools for finishing work. He does not have hand machinery at the moment.

Luis learned his trade working as an assistant to a foreman who taught him everything about the business. Now, if his loan is approved, he can be competitive. It upsets him not to be able to accept work just because he does not have the necessary tools. It worries him as he has a baby that needs to be fed. Luis needs your help!

loans.use: to buy the hand tools he lacks so he will be offered more construction jobs.

loans.name: Marsih

texts.en:
Marsih is 34 years old and married. She lives with her husband and her children. She has two daughters. She has a food business. Usually she and her husband sell rice, cakes for direct-consumption shoppers. This business over 12 years. She was glad to help increase family income.

She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 6,000,000 rupiah. This loan will be used to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family. She wants to have access to safe sanitation for families. Her family income is still not enough to build toilets and water resources with cash, but they are able to repay loans received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all of lenders.

loans.use: To buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home, to improve access to water and sanitation for their family

loans.name: Rex

texts.en: Rex is a rice retailer from Iloilo, Philippines. He is 52 years old, is married and has three grown up children. Rex has been in the business for more than nine years now. This is the source of his income. Rex is asking for a loan to buy more rice. With a loan, he will be able to improve his stocks of rice, thus allowing him to sell more to his buyers. In the future, Rex hopes to improve his business in order to augment his income.

loans.use: to buy more rice

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a charcoal retailer from Iloilo, Philippines. She is 47 years old and a mother of four children. Susan has been selling charcoal for more than 4 years now. This is the source of her income. 

Susan is asking for a loan to buy more charcoal to sell. With a loan, she will be able to increase her charcoal stocks, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. 

In the future, Susan hopes of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the reinvestment of the same venture and to pay for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Diego

texts.en:
Diego sends you his thanks for your generosity because his previous loan had enriched his business. He was able to buy products and supplies, which are needed in his business. The loan also helped him provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

He is very positive that he could improve his business more if you will let him borrow again an amount of 50,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional tailoring supplies like fabric, cloth, thread and needles he needs to improve his service and profit. Simultaneously, he could sustain the needs of his family through the help of this assistance.

Diego hopes to grow and expand soon. He desires to help his relatives through his business and he dreams to become successful. He meets every week with his *co-fellowship members to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in his business.

loans.name: Moises Alberto

texts.es:
Con gran entusiasmo Moises recorre los pasillos de su universidad para ir a los laboratorios a recibir clases, Moisesa sus 22 años cursa el tercer año de Medicina y Cirugía, siempre se ha caracterizado por tener esa disposición de servir a los demás por eso decidió que la medicina era su mejor camino para ayudar a las personas. Moises es un joven dedicado a sus estudios, emprendedor y responsable. Cuenta con el apoyo de su madre quien siempre se ha preocupado por el bienestar de su educación, tratando de formarlo en un profesional. 
Moises solicita el crédito para la compra de una computadora, enciclopedia médica y equipos de medicina como Diapason y estuche de disección de Cirugía, estos instrumentos los utilizara para su formación académica que le permitirán realizar sus prácticas en cualquier centro médico. Deposita su confianza en el financiamiento para la compra de sus equipos que le ayudaran a graduarse como médico. Moises tiene como meta estudiar pediatría y de esa manera podrá servir en zonas rurales, también podrá estudiar otras especializaciones que le ayudara a realizarse como profesional, de ese modo logrará cumplir sus sueños de ayudar a las comunidades.
texts.en:
Moises walks the corridors of his university with great enthusiasm to reach the labs and take his classes. He is 22 years old and in his third year of medicine and surgery school.

He's always been of a disposition to serve others, that's why he decided that medicine is the best way for him to help people. 

He is dedicated to his studies, enterprising and responsible. He is supported by his mother, who has always cared for his education, encouraging him to become a professional. 

Moises is requesting the loan to buy a computer, a medical encyclopedia, and medical instruments such as a diapason and a surgical dissection kit, which he will use during training at any medical center.  

He is relying on this loan to purchase these instruments that will help him to graduate as medical doctor. 

Moises aims to study  pediatrics and practice in rural zones. He will also be able to study other specialties and become an accomplished professional, thus reaching his dream of helping the communities.

loans.use: to buy a computer, a medical encyclopedia, and medical instruments such as a diapason and a surgical dissection kit.

loans.name: Marta Olga

texts.es:
Marta es una mujer de 61 años de edad, trabaja en un almacén, oferta sus servicios de tejidos y vende artículos religiosos, es separada y depende únicamente de su negocio para salir adelante.
Madre de una hija ya mayor de edad pero en momentos difíciles trata de apoyarla económicamente, el almacén que ven en la foto es heredado y quiere invertir para hacer que este no desparezca pues las ventas no son muy buenas.
Marta dará u giro radical a su almacén sin perder la esencia, solicita un crédito para la compra de juguetería y artículos religioso buscando mayor competitividad en el mercado y un mejor volumen de ventas. 
Ayuda a esta veterana mujer a levantar su negocio, ella espera tu apoyo.
texts.en:
Marta is a 61-year-old woman who works in a market where she provides sewing services and sells religious items. She is separated and depends solely on her business to make a living. 

She is the mother of one grown daughter, but in difficult times she tries to support her financially. The store seen in the photo was inherited, and she wants to invest in it so that it stays in business when sales are not as high. 

Marta will turnaround her business without having to lose its essence. She is asking for loan in order to purchase toys and other religious items – as a way to stay competitive in the market and have a higher volume of sales. 

Help this woman improve her business as she is asking for your support.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of toys and religious items.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 49 years old and a hard working entrepreneur from Coron, Palawan, Philippines.  She is married to Narciso, her business partner, and has six children.  Three of the children are in high school, two are in elementary level and the other one is already working. She and her husband catch and sell fresh fish to provide for the everyday needs and expenditures of the family.

Fishing is one of the common sources of income in Coron Island, since most of the folks are living near seashore lines.  She and her husband prepare their fishing tools and accessories like nets, rod holders, bait prep and tanks, grippers, knives and more. After hours of bearing the scorching heat of the sun,  they go back to the shore with other fishermen with their nets full of tons of fresh-caught fish. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of the freshness and cleanliness. Aside from selling fish, she also has a small general store by their house for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue her business, she is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan to repair her boat, and buy grocery items such as rice, noodles, oil and eggs to sell at retail. She is positive for a good harvest of fresh fish and increased sales of groceries this coming Christmas. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good turnout of her business and the financial help that will be given her, for it is a great help to sustain her family's daily needs and for the education of her children. She wishes everyone a Blessed Christmas!

Lucila hopes to buy another boat and grow her small general store to uplift their lives. She prays for safety and God's guidance on her business and family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

 *All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for repair of her boat, and buy grocery items for her small general store as well.

loans.name: He Muong 5 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thai, 26, is from a Thai minority. She is married and has two small children: a girl and a boy. She lives with her husband and her kids, along with her parents-in-law in a small Thai traditional house in a remote village where people mostly work at agricultural production for a living, and Mrs. Thai's family is not an exception. Indeed, they cultivate rice, cassava, and corn and breed buffalo, pigs, and goats. With the experience in agriculture and the success from the investment of the previous loan in pigs, Mrs. Thai was confident enough to take out her third loan from the ACE Program. She will use it to buy young goats.
 
Mrs. Thai hopes that her investment will go well so that she can better support her family, especially her children. She dreams her children will have a more abundant life, study well and have a good job. In the picture, she stands first from the right.

loans.use: to buy young goats

loans.name: Uhuru Group

texts.en:
Mwanaidi, a business woman running several activities, is in her late 30s. She is married and has three children. Two of her children attend school and one is still young. She has been selling charcoal. She buys two to three bags at a time and splits them into small bundles to resell. Mafungu, Mamalishe, and selling water are her other businesses. She works very hard, trying in every way to secure her family's lifestyle. She dreams to take her children to a better school and to give them a good life. Mwanaidi works from 6am to 10pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

She has approached Tujijenge to request financial support in order to improve her businesses and grow her income. This is not her first credit request. She used the previous loans, all of which she paid back successfully, to buy inventory for her businesses, especially mamalishe cooking items such as rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, maize, and baking flour, as well as charcoal. She earned a little profit, which she used to pay school fees and some of her household expenses. 

She is so proud to be a Kiva borrower, and thankful to everyone who supports micro-businesses around the world. With this new credit request she will buy cooking ingredients for her mamalishe business, water, and sacks of charcoal for her store. She will share this loan with her group, Uhuru, which has five members. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients, water, and sacks of charcoal.
